Please notice, that this "Kickstarter mini-expansion" is designed as promo-cards, they are not perfectly balanced or nearly as thoroughly tested as our regular cards are. We do not recommend to use them in the first few games, but for experienced players, especially the ladies add more complexity during the first rounds - and alters the tactics immensely. Have fun!
189102.name: Among Nobles: Promo Character Cards

189103.name: Hannin wa Kono Naka ni Iru!
189103.description:
User summary:
犯人はこの中にいる! (Hannin Ha Kono Naka Ni Iru!) means "The culprit is right here with us!" in English.

This card game follows the story-line of detective novels.

Each player is assigned a character who has three characteristics: nationality, gender, and physique. Players play event cards, detective cards, trick cards, and story cards to determine the culprit's characteristics.

It is not important who is the culprit. Everyone just tries to brand another player as the culprit. You can earn big points by playing a scoring card named "The culprit is right here with us!", which steals points from other players according to the number of characteristics that they share with the culprit. Or by finalizing the game with "You are the culprit!" scoring card, when the target player has all characteristics of the culprit.

A succession of turnovers may happen in a game, so play several times and add up the scores to determine the grand champion.

There is also an expansion to the game, called Shin Hannin wa Kono Naka ni Iru!

Publisher's summary:
推理小説のストーリー展開をイメージしたゲームです。
各プレイヤーには、国籍、性別、体格の３つの特徴を持った人物カードが割り当てられます。イベントカード、探偵カード、トリックカード、様々なストーリーカードを駆使しながら、犯人の特徴を決めていき、他のプレイヤーが犯人になるように陥れていきます。
合致した特徴分の点数を全プレイヤーから奪う「犯人はこの中にいる！」で得点を稼ぎ、「犯人はお前だ！！」カードで確定出来れば、高得点を奪って1ゲーム終了となります。
逆転につぐ逆転があるゲームなので、トータルで得点を競う連続ゲームがお勧めです。

189104.name: Shin Hannin wa Kono Naka ni Iru!
189104.description:
User summary:
真犯人はこの中にいる! (Shin Hannin Ha Kono Naka Ni Iru!) in English means "The real culprit is right here with us!".

This game is actually an expansion to Hannin wa Kono Naka ni Iru!. With this expansion, character cards are hidden information and you have an advantage if you know who your opponents are.

New cards are added to gain clues of opponents' characters.

189105.name: Dust Tactics: Kampfgruppe Christoph
189105.description:
From the publisher:

The Neue Deutsches Afrikakorps (NDAK) has arrived in the Middle East! Along with the rest of Operation Babylon's forces, the Korps is now fighting the Allies and the SSU in this part of the World.

Dust Studio is very proud to present this new starter with slightly revamped rules for Dust Tactics! The very beginning of a new era starts now with an amazing box full of treasures!
We're certain that it will appeal to new players and veterans alike. Whether you're new to the World of Dust or have been hanging out with us for some time now, you'll love the NDAK Starter Set: Kampfgruppe Christoph.

189106.name: Taverns and Tales
189106.description:
User summary:

Taverns and Tales is a rules-light, fast-start role playing game. The game is played on a board grid with token representing individuals. Movement is along the grid, by squares. Character creation involves selecting a character Class, which subsequently determines all other character abilities and statistics. For example, all Bards have 5 Stamina, 13 Defense, 7 Speed, 4 Weapon, a Guitar Accessory, and Inflict 4 damage, as well as having a predetermined kit of equipment and a specified special ability. It is suggested that scenarios be created prior to play and not improvised. An introductory scenario, "Troubled Village", is provided. This rapid setup is much like a board game, but play subsequently follows typical role-playing methods. The rules note, however, that the method of setup does allow for easy solitaire play.

189108.name: Voyage of the Promethean
189108.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1517; Stage One: Josh Mannon; Stage Two: Ryan Ó Laoithe; Stage Three: Abram Bussiere
Stage Two Title: Space Fight 3 Billion: Vagabond Merchants

189109.name: Monopoly: Sanrio Game Master Edition
189109.description:
From the publisher:

Welcome to Sanrio Game Master Monopoly. Step into the classic gaming world with this limited edition of Monopoly, as you search for the Ultimate Game Master, Hello Kitty. Along the way, player will have to visit the 7 Game Masters to collect as many Game Zones, toy houses and toy villas as they can. They will be surprised that their fates will be twisted as they roll the dice. The one who has the greatest number of Game Zones, toy houses and toy villas will be honored by the Ultimate Game Master, Hello Kitty, to become one of the Game Masters in this board game. Come take the challenge and win the throne of Game Master.

189110.name: The Prophet's Price
189110.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1518; Stage One: Kevin McIntyre; Stage Two: Mendel Schmeidekamp; Stage Three: David Rothfeder
Stage One and Two Title: Ripples in Time

189112.name: Fallen Sky
189112.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1519; Stage One: Scott Slomiany; Stage Two: "The Scablander"; Stage Three: Jay Treat
Stage One Title: Bad Air




From the Introduction:

It’s 1862 and you’ve been hired to protect the construction of what will be the first transcontinental railroad. Like most of the middle states, Kansas still hasn’t recovered from the devastation caused by the Yosemite eruption before the turn of the century. No sane folk live between the soot of the sky and the ash of the earth, but you’re here now to see that the East gets access to the precious fruit and produce that grow west of the Rockies. The trouble is the folk who do live here.

In addition to the great famine, the air poisons the land and the water, emaciating and driving mad the humans and mammals exposed to it. People become so listless they might as well be dead. But they don’t die. No one understands it, but these diseased individuals go on, without memory, sense of self, or any civilization. They are called ‘husks’ and they are a pitiful nuisance at best, terrifyingly dangerous the rest of the time, attacking normal humans on sight, clawing and biting without regard for civility or their own safety.

Your job is to protect the rail workers as they lay the track west, and you do, but the railroad also asks you to clear out ghost towns that are in the way, to investigate worrisome occurrences, and to handle the locals however necessary. Your title is wrangler, but some call you railroader.

189113.name: Creeks and Crawdads (Impact System)
189113.description:
From the introduction:

Creeks and Crawdads was originally published by M. Martin Costa in 1986. It's a fun little game, especially in concept...[but] the game mechanics, while functional, are very 80's in style (unsurprisingly). The rules are very firmly rooted in their wargaming and D&D ancestry - an unfriendly and overly complex combat system.

[Creeks and Crawdads (Impact System)] is meant to be an entire replacement for the original Creeks and Crawdads game.

User summary:

The Impact System version of the game retains the D6 dice pool of the original, but collapses the original nine Attributes to only four (Fighting Ability, Intelligence, Tool Use, Awareness) and overhauls the core mechanic to be much simpler. This allows a focus on the strengths of the quirky game concepts.

189114.name: Rasbar Wonderbringer
189114.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rasbar is a chaotic good male gnome with sorcerer levels of the arcane bloodline who has specialized in illusion. He excels in deception and trickery through magic and can often bypass confrontation with his illusions.

Product Overview

Oops! That six-hour marathon game session started 15 minutes ago, and you have already killed a player character (PC)! He was decapitated while being consumed in dragon fire, and his corpse fell into a sphere of annihilation. Your prediction for recovery is “not likely.” You built pre-generated characters for this campaign six months and four character levels ago! You don’t want your player to sit and read the newspaper for the next 5.75 hours. You need a comparable-level character sheet quickly.

OR… A new player has just shown up to your table willing to learn to sling dice. You found out he or she was coming thirty minutes before game time. Your regular crew of miscreants has already killed off all the spare pre-generated characters you rolled up with gleeful abandon, while cackling wildly and uttering something about “drive ‘em like you stole ‘em.” You want this first gaming experience to be fun and memorable, so you don’t want to completely wing it. You need a character sheet, right now.

Welcome to Instant Character! Just add a player, and go! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules. The core format adheres to the standard non-player character (NPC) stat block most GMs are already familiar with minus the Tactics section. This makes it easier for the GM to assist with finding information and also prepares the player for the day he or she is running games! The Special Abilities section includes more detailed write-ups of feats and character abilities than a standard NPC stat block to facilitate faster play. Sources for spells, races, classes, archetypes, and prestige classes from sources other than the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ (PZO1110) are listed in the Sources section and can be referenced in the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Reference Document.

At the end of this document is a sheet of character and spell tokens including a token for this character and assorted Non-Player Characters (NPCs) and spell effects. For best results, print the token page and laminate the entire sheet. Initially cut out into squares. To improve ability to move and pick up the laminated tokens, trim off the gray corners to make an octagonal shape.

189115.name: Into the Wild
189115.description:
From publisher blurb:

Written for the most recent edition of the most popular fantasy role playing game! This supplement is a collection of 12 very short adventures meant to be dropped into an existing low-level campaign. Additionally all maps contained within the supplement have been provided for use in Virtual Table Top programs!

For those using a VTT program, each square on the grid should be 100 pixels wide.

Goblin Camp - a small tribe of goblins have infested an abandoned lookout tower, and have begun to raid lightly armed caravans that use the nearby road.
Stirge Matriarch - a bloated monstrousity has taken up residence in a nearby marsh, and began birthing stirges at an alarming rate.
Cutting Down Trees - a logging camp has come under attack by unseen forces.
Lurking in the Webs - the fey living in the forest have become victims for a horror that enjoys the taste of their flesh.
Old Witch of the Woods - be careful what you wish for, and be careful what you bargain with.
Brigands - criminals and bandits make travel dangerous.
A Grand Hunt - the local Duke is looking for able hunters to supply an upcoming banquet.
One Eye - some times, wizards shouldn't look to improve on nature.
Treasure Hunt - the lure of gold is often too much.
Stolen Cattle - giants have no respect for smaller folk.
Uncovered Tombs - some things even necromancers fear...
Filthy Games - a group of mud mephits have caused the road to turn into a quagmire. What will it take to stop them?

189116.name: Tomes of Power (Revised)
189116.description:
From publsiher blurb:

Call to Arms is a book line for players and gamemasters alike. Each book focuses on a different type of item, expanding rules for those items and adding everything from new mundane and magical examples of the item to new character options related to the item.

Call to Arms: Tomes of Power (Revised) updates one of the original Call to Arms books to the current design and includes a vast expansion to rules and magical options related to books and other written material. Discover everything from why you’d want that Heritage Book, to why you shouldn’t want (though perhaps you secretly do) to plumb the depths of the fabled Necronomicon. In addition, Tomes of Power (Revised) introduces new books, both magical and mundane, and new rules for gamemasters to provide greater exploratory challenges in foreign languages and ancient texts.

189117.name: Untitled (Threeforged Challenge Entry #1522)
189117.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1522; Stage One: Thor Hansen; Stage Two: David LaFreniere; Stage Three: Fred Bednarski




Note this entry is officially untitled. The Stage Three version of this game is intended for the FU: the Free, Universal RPG RPG. The Stage One and Two versions include their own unrelated system.

From the Introduction:

Introduction: During the Fall of 1812 Napoleon was gripped in a fight for control of Russia. His soldiers were working their way forward and the end was in sight. At the doors of Moscow, the Russian emperor called for his cabinet and asked for any way they could turn back the enemy. A plan was hatched to use the most powerful magics at their disposal. A burst of magic flowed from that camp and city far and wide. It is said that the explosion could be seen from the eastern parts of Scotland and heard in the heart of the Levant.
Moscow became a gateway. Creatures imbued with magical properties are tearing through Capitals and villages. National boundaries meant nothing to them. Europe, the grand palaces, and the heart of modern civilization, is in jeopardy. England, perhaps because of the water of the Channel, is so far untouched.

What this game is about: Journey, Improvisation and Exploration. The players are specialists hired by the newly formed Crisis Congress who are going to make their way to Moscow. They have been tasked with closing this fount of magical beings and restoring Europe to its former glory. But the road to Moscow is long and far from easy. Thanks to the magical blight, Europe is more foreign and even more alien than the Far East or Deep Afrika.

189118.name: Battle Plan
189118.description:
Rules for a play by mail board game, the object of which is to control the world. Includes rules for combat, treaties and negotiation, espionage and occupation of minors.

Includes a 16 page rulebook and a 22 x 35" map of the earth.

189119.name: Death Warrant (ICONS)
189119.description:
From publisher blurb:

I am the the one you need. I can make your problems go away. I will be a scalpel if you need one and the hammer when you don't. Show me your problems and I'll be the one to sign their Death Warrant.

Enemy Strike Files are character packs detailing a villainous threat for your Icons Assembled Edition games. The Enemies are extensively detailed so that they can be seamlessly integrated into your games; from a one-shot to an ongoing campaign.

189120.name: Timelines
189120.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1523; Stage One: Bill White; Stage Two: Willow Palacek; Stage Three: Chris Longhurst
Stage One Title: Time Hack

189121.name: Gut Check: The Microbiome Game
189121.description:
Gut Check is a game for 2-4 players where each player attempts to develop a healthy microbiome while interfering with the microbiomes of their opponents. Give your friends the plague, botulism and more! Go to work sick to get rid of a pathogen, take some probiotics, or have some lasagna (if you can digest it). The game takes 30-60 minutes to play, depending on experience and number of players.

Gut Check draws on elements from a number of games including Pandemic, Magic: The Gathering, and Dominion. While the game plays equally well with 2, 3, or 4 players the strategy changes in each case. Optimal play revolves around hand management, card cycling, striking a balance between building your own microbiome or playing cards to interfere with opponents, and timing various events.

189122.name: Wargamer's Guide to The Battle of the Bulge
boardgameversion: Wargamer's Guide to The Battle of the Bulge
189122.description:
Guidon Games Wargamer's Guidebook Series WG102-200
Wargamer's Guide to The Battle of the Bulge.

Small pamphlet the compliments Avalon Hill's classic Battle of the Bulge.

Donald Greenwood, Editor
Don Lowry, Illustrator

189123.description:
Relicblade is a small scale fantasy skirmish game where one player takes command of a party of heroes on their righteous quest, while the other player harnesses the brutal fury of the pig men. Brave and wicked alike are drawn to powerful relics lost in the ruins of the ancient world.

The characters are represented on the board by detailed 30mm miniatures while their statistics and abilities are shown on convenient character cards. The real tactical depth comes in as players choose from 25 unique upgrades to specialize their characters to gain a tactical advantage. Will you choose to specialize your druid as a support healer, or upgrade her bear form into a DPS monstrosity?

Battles are fought over an unidentified magic item that has drawn the characters to that spot. When characters are finally able to seize the relic it is drawn randomly from the Relic Deck. Relics grant an unnatural boon and are used just like upgrades, however they far surpass any upgrade in power. But if the character wielding the relic is disabled anyone can pick it up.

Standard games of Relicblade are played on a 2'x2' area, and players usually only field between three and six characters. Standard games usually last around 45 minutes. Relicblade is fast paced, dynamic, and fun.
189123.name: Relicblade: adventure battle game

189124.name: République Deluxe Edition
189124.description:
User Summary

République Deluxe Edition includes all five episodes. The PS4 release has been optimized for the console.

189125.name: République - Episode 2: Metamorphosis
189125.description:
You receive a desperate phone call from Hope, a young woman trapped within a shadowy totalitarian state. Using a stolen phone, she calls and begs you to hack into the nation’s surveillance system, assume control, and help her escape from the clutches of the omnipresent Overseer.

Source: The Publisher Website.

189126.name: République - Episode 3: Ones and Zeroes
189126.description:
You receive a desperate phone call from Hope, a young woman trapped within a shadowy totalitarian state. Using a stolen phone, she calls and begs you to hack into the nation’s surveillance system, assume control, and help her escape from the clutches of the omnipresent Overseer.

Source: The Publisher Website.

189127.name: République - Episode 4: God's Acre
189127.description:
You receive a desperate phone call from Hope, a young woman trapped within a shadowy totalitarian state. Using a stolen phone, she calls and begs you to hack into the nation’s surveillance system, assume control, and help her escape from the clutches of the omnipresent Overseer.

Source: The Publisher Website.

189128.name: République - Episode 5: Terminus
189128.description:
You receive a desperate phone call from Hope, a young woman trapped within a shadowy totalitarian state. Using a stolen phone, she calls and begs you to hack into the nation’s surveillance system, assume control, and help her escape from the clutches of the omnipresent Overseer.

Source: The Publisher Website.

189129.name: Ancient Empires
videogamehonor: 2006 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2006 D.I.C.E. Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Winner
189129.description:
The game takes place in a fantasy medieval kingdom of Thorin ruled by the benevolent King Galamar. The game begins with Galamar barely escaping a bloody coup by his younger brother Valadorn, who has taken control of the kingdom and declared a hunt on his brother. Galamar has few troops with him, and he is constantly being attacked by Valadorn's Red Legion. In the first part of the campaign, Galamar has to gather allies in order to strike back at his brother. These allies include the Lizard King, the Wizards of the Grey Tower, the Wyverns captured by Valadorn's forces, etc. Once Galamar defeats Valadorn for the last time, he realizes that his brother was under demonic control. The game ends with a cliffhanger.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ancient Empires (mobile game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189130.name: Ancient Empires II
189130.description:
The sequel begins almost immediately after the first game ends, as Galamar and Valadorn (free from spell) must now fight off a demonic invasion headed by the demon Saeth. The brothers split up in their attempt to defend their land. They find out that the demons focus their attacks on several temples and are stealing mystical crystals. They finally arrive to face Saeth himself, only to find that he has used the crystals to activate an ancient weapon of great power - Heaven's Fury. Now the brothers must use whatever forces they have with them to defeat Saeth's army and the great demon himself before he is able to destroy the kingdom with the weapon.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ancient Empires (mobile game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189131.name: The Incredibles: Escape from Nomanisan Island
videogamehonor: 2005 D.I.C.E. Downloadable Game of the Year Winner
189131.description:
User Summary

The game features Mr. and Mrs. Incredible and their kids, Violet and Dash, the superhero stars of the blockbuster Walt Disney Pictures presentation of a Pixar Animation Studios film “The Incredibles,” as they try to escape Nomanisan Island while facing wave after wave of the evil forces of their foe, Syndrome.

189132.name: The Xelusine, Sirens of Sin
189132.description:
From publisher blurb:

This volume is the siren song of the Xelusine, seducers from the deep. Born of a corrupted wish, these drow are worshiped by cultists rather than served by slaves. They offer forbidden pleasures wherever they roam, and bless their most devoted disciples with the gift of becoming drow, themselves. Heedless of noble houses, without families to hold them back, the Xelusine create a world in which everything is permitted, if desire can make it so.

Highlights of this chapter include:

A template for converting other races to drow
Special systems for temptation and satisfaction
The cult leadership feat, with downtime and mass combat options
Apathy, avarice, gluttony, and vanity domains, with their subdomains

189133.name: Point Salad: The Salad-Building Game
189133.description:
In Point Salad, you take on the role of a hungry customer trying to squeeze into a crowded salad bar to snag limited ingredients. You will be building a salad made of overlapping cards in front of you. Every ingredient has a unique scoring condition, and quantities of each are extremely limited — the servers never seem to refill the salad bar — so you've got to hurry and snag the ones that will make your salad the best of all!

In more detail, using a rondel-based mechanism, you move your meeple on your turn to one of the three salad bar stations in front of you, perform the action that corresponds to that station, then take the ingredient available there. If another player's meeple is currently located at the station you want to visit, you can bump them — but doing so allows them to leave the line and move to any unoccupied station, giving them a free ingredient and action.

189134.description:
The Viticulture Essential Upgrade Pack turns a second-edition copy of Viticulture into the Essential Edition. The Tuscany expansions in this pack (Properties [now called Fields], Mamas & Papas, advanced and new visitors, and Automa [solo variant]) were hand-picked by famed designer Uwe Rosenberg.

Tuscany owners already have this content.
189134.name: Viticulture Essential Upgrade Pack

189135.name: Fylgia
189135.description:
Fylgia is a abstract strategy game. The winner is the player with playing pieces left on the board.

Every player has 5 pieces and the board is 8x5 big. On your turn you can only move one step diagonally. And you can also only strike diagonally. Every time you do a standard move you can change a bonus-counter one step to a max of three. To use your bonus is the only way to move in a straight line, in any direction accept diagonally. And you have to move as many steps as your bonus-counter is on. Before or after such movement your are allowed to do a standard move diagonally. After the movement is done, the bonus-counter is reduced to nil, and you have to start to get new bonus.

189136.name: Frigid Bitch
189136.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have three Statistics (Attributes), including Gear, Work, and Heart. Players distribute 7 points among these three statistics at creation. Characters have two derived scores that vary during play: Luck and Fear. Action resolution pits a character's dice pool (the number of dice depending on the relevant Statistic value) against an opponent's dice pool.

Game play proceeds through four "chapters": Countryside, Castle, Courting, and (optionally) Escape. Play thus tends to proceed similarly between games though of course the character actions will vary with each iteration.

189137.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 2.

2 Buildings and 1 Vehicle:
Peat-Fired Brickworks
Peat Power Plant
Coach-and-Four

Story: East Frisia was best suited to run a brick factory:there was plenty of easy-to-mine clay, peat for fuel, and many waterways for transport to and from. In the 19th century, there were 26 brick factories in Rheiderland alone, a small part of East Frisia along the river Ems. Today there are only 2 brick factories left in all East Frisia, one of which is the peatfired brick factory in Nenndorf, a neighboring village of Arle. It is the only brick factory left in Europe using peat as fuel. Its 40 meter long kiln is burning up to 3 million bricks per year.

Story: East Frisia was always abundant in peat and water (you could even say overabundant). When industrial peat cutting was introduced in the early 20th century, the power plant in Wiesmoor was built in order to press ahead with the moor colonization. It went into operation in 1909 and was producing electricity until 1965, burning through up to 120,000 tons of peat per year. In 1925, a greenhouse plantation was built next to the power plant to make use of the waste heat. Back then, the greenhouse was mainly growing vegetables. Unlike the power plant, the greenhouse is still up and running today, producing 4 million pot plants per year!
189137.name: Fields of Arle: Advent Calendar Expansion

189138.name: Island at the Dawn of Time
rpg: Island at the Dawn of Time
189138.description:
User summary:

Island at the Dawn of Time is a very unusual role-playing game. The mechanic is diceless and the game uses no Game Master. Instead, players take turns and use simple "guess a number" mechanics to resolve actions (there is no real conflict in the game). The goal of the game is to create names for things and then have those names become permanently established in the game world. When names become a permanent fixture the creating player gains a Machina, which is analogous to a score point.

189139.name: Aliens Online
videogamehonor: 1998 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Nominee
189139.description:
It is based on the science fiction horror film Aliens. Notable features of Aliens Online included asymmetric teams, teams consisting of more players than found in most first-person shooters of its era, job/class specialization, and its RPG elements. Players could fight on either the side of the United States Colonial Marines or on the side of the Aliens. Scenarios were played in one of six different types of terrain sets, with upwards of twenty to thirty players per side during each instance.

Source: Wikipedia, "Aliens Online", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189140.name: GemStone IV
videogamehonor: 1998 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Nominee
189140.description:
GemStone III went into open beta testing in December 1989, officially launching on February 1, 1990. The transition from "II" to "III" maintained significant portions of the environment, but not all, and character records were not maintained over the transition, requiring all players to begin anew. GemStone III evolved into GemStone IV in November 2003, but the game world and character records were maintained over the transition. GemStone III was promoted on GEnie by promising players the opportunity to receive real-life versions of gems found in-game, something that persisted for many years.

Source: Wikipedia, "GemStone IV", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189142.name: I must kill...: Fresh Meat
189142.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

I must kill...: Fresh Meat is based on the sad story of a butcher. One day, one night, one accident will light up his misty past and memories.

189143.name: Don't Take My Word
189143.description:
Letter cards are slowly turned one-by-one for all players to see. When you can spell a word, shout it out, take the cards, and place the word in front of you.

If no player can spell a word using the first three cards, deal additional cards until a word is found. You need not use all the revealed letters, but can use only as many of the letters as you need.

A player can also steal a word from another player at any time—Add letters to make a new word, or combine words from different players or from your own finished words.

189144.name: QuIRC: Quick IRC Roleplaying
189144.description:
User summary:

QuIRC implements a randomization method that utilizes the timestamps of actions to determine randomly the outcomes. The rules are simple and can be used with any genre; the mechanics are designed to support Internet Relay Chat (IRC) play, but they could be adapted to any "instant message" system that can timestamp text exchanges. It would be very difficult to utilize the mechanic with a verbal exchange.

Characters, called Protagonists, gain one Point every time the timestamp Hour increments. Points can be spent during play to alter the narrative sequence. Otherwise, play proceeds in a progression of narrative turns. If a Point is spent then the timestamp provides two values - Destiny and Nemesis - which are utilized to determine the outcome.

189145.name: Albraxas: Storming the Dawn
189145.description:
User summary:

In Albraxas: Storming the Dawn, one player takes on the role of Albraxas and the remaining players generate characters. In some (minor) respects, the Albraxas role is analogous to a traditional Game Master role, but in general Albraxas is antagonistic to the characters and attempts to thwart and destroy their actions. The game also is peculiar in many other aspects.

Characters have three Attributes: Backbone, Battle, and Blitz. Characters distribute 13 points among these abilities, while Albraxas has 20 points to distribute. Another derived Attribute, Dynamism, is calculated. Dynamism is spent to perform actions. Opposed actions pit dice pool rolls against the opponents dice pool roll. No die type is specified, but all players should use the same die type.

The game is played through a pre-selected number of Phases (turns), being either 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, 36, 49, 64, 81, or 100. Albraxas moves through the phase backwards. Characters can perform an action in a given phase, selecting from a list of five possible actions.

189146.name: Circus Attractions
videogameversion: English/German European Atari ST 3.5" disk edition
English/German European Commodore Amiga 3.5" disk (Top Shots re-release) edition
English/German European Commodore Amiga 3.5" disk edition
English/German European Commodore Amiga 3.5" disk with Miniature edition
189146.description:
User Summary

In Circus Attractions the player is performing various attractions in the Big Top. The game can be played single player, or cooperatively. The acts are:

Trampolining - The basic skills here are simply to time your jumps to go higher. However the crowd quickly tires of this (indicated by an on-screen gauge). To maintain interest, the player must perform somersaults. In the two player version, jumps are controlled individually, but if one player initiates a somersault, the other player follows. Timing is therefore key such that both players can successfully land.

Tightrope Walking - The player moves forward automatically but must balance. Bonus objects can be collected with artistic acts such as a scissorkick or handstand. In the two player mode, the second player stands on the shoulders of the first. Both must keep balance, but only the top player can perform artistic acts.

Juggling - This starts simple by controlling the throwing and catching of balls between two hands. However soon you have to deal with a ball being kept aloft using your foot, the collecting of additional objects and jumping to avoid a motorbike! The two player mode has the players throwing balls to each other, but timing the taking of additional items is crucial in order to keep the rhythm.

Knife Throwing - The player must take and throw knives at a lady strapped to a rotating disk. Taking too long between shots will cause your assistant to casually throw knives into the audience (!) and he will occasionally attempt to pass you a stick of dynamite rather than a knife. In the two player version, both players are throwing at the disk simultaneously.

Jumping Clowns - Three clowns and two see-saws. Jumping on one end of a see-saw catapults a clown across the screen to the other see-saw, hopefully in turn sending another clown back in the opposite direction. Bonuses can be collected when flying across the screen. In the two player mode, players take turns directing the trajectory of a flying clown.

189147.name: Rivers and Lakes (Jiang Hu)
189147.description:
User summary:

Rivers and Lakes (Jiang Hu) was contest entry focused on genre redesign. Character creation involves creating a School, which involves available skills, training, and social position. Each school also offers training in one of five martial arts styles. Players distribute points among these various attributes at character creation. Characters also have additional traits designed by narrative tags. Conflict resolution is performed by accumulating a pool of Victory Dice, based on their Integrity Attribute. The dice pool results are compared to an action table to determine outcome.

189148.name: Air Warrior III
videogamehonor: 1999 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Nominee
189148.description:
Air Warrior III had as one playing area a map of northern Europe, besides many small playing fields with some real-life features labeled. Berlin, the Kiel Canal, and Peenemünde were unmarked in the game. There was also a playing area map that included a hodgepodge of Pacific islands and the coast of Australia.

Source: Wikipedia, "Air Warrior", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189149.name: DragonRealms - Maritime Expansion
videogamehonor: 1999 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Nominee
189149.description:
User Summary

The expansion introduces new areas and new mechanics. The maritime expansion will add an entire new province located in a series of islands off the coast of the original three provinces.

189150.name: Adventure in the Tower of Flight
189150.description:
User Summary

To become the new king of the world, your character jumps and flies to a certain extent inside a tower, going from level to level to find hidden relics. There is a sword to kill enemies and trunks to open with coins and life hearts.

189151.description: Crack of the Bat (COTB) Baseball is a dice driven baseball game that uses player and pitcher cards with realistic stats to simulate the game of baseball. A single roll of four 10-sided dice (red, blue, green and white) provides almost all the play resolution. Different combinations of these dice (blue-white, red-white and green-white) determine if the result is read from the pitcher or batter card, and whether the result is a hit or an out. All aspects of the game - fielding, stolen bases, hit location, strikeouts, etc. - can be simulated with the COTB system.
189151.name: Crack of the Bat Baseball Dice Game

189152.name: Boggle: M Happy Meal
189152.description:
The game components consist of eight strips, each with four letters on each side, printed in a vertical column. Four of these strips are taken at randon and arranged on a 4x4 square.
Players try to form as many words as possible from the letters in the array, Each letter used in a word must be connected orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to the next. Players score one point per letter with an extra point for any Q used. Most points wins.

189154.description:
From Lone Shark Games and Monte Cook Games comes The Ninth World: A Skillbuilding Game for Numenera, an epic card game set in the far-future world of Numenera.

The Ninth World is a card game for 1 to 5 players. It can be played competitively, cooperatively, or in solo mode. Each player plays a Nano, Jack, or Glaive. Each character is described with an adjective ("I am a learned..."), noun ("...nano..."), and verb phrase ("...who rides the lightning").

Characters will explore one of the nine kingdoms of The Steadfast—or they may venture into the even stranger lands of the Beyond. Each kingdom is illustrated with a set of five region cards. Over the course of a quick five-round game, the characters will simultaneously explore the starting region on round 1, then continue out to the region on the far reaches of the kingdom. In a standard game of nine rounds, they'll then head back home on the other side of the card.
Each round, characters will choose how much time to spend performing actions with their five skills — scouting the wilderness, tinkering with cyphers and oddities, charming allies, combating creatures, and focusing on skill advancement — and then bid against the other heroes for the choicest cards. Each phase, a character can adventure in the town, where rewards are predictable and creatures not so dangerous. Or they can head out to the wilderness, where strange cyphers have unpredictable powers and the creatures look to bash you into oblivion.

Gameplay is simultaneous and every action is rewarded with victory points. Whoever has the most points at the end is the most legendary adventurer.

In co-op mode, characters can work together to defeat the creatures and garner the relics, but there's a catch: the wilderness is trying to kill the town. Cards flip off the wilderness deck, and the characters have to take them out before the creatures destroy the town locations and the relics and quests make it impossible for them to win. Or a character can go it alone in solo mode, which is like that except no one is there to help.
189154.name: The Ninth World: A Skillbuilding Game for Numenera
boardgamepodcastepisode: Favorite Games of 2015
Strange Assembly 190 - GenCon 2016 Preview
Strange Assembly 192 - Live From GenCon 2016
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 56!!!

189155.name: Futari Machi
boardgamepublisher: イマジンゲームズ (imagine GAMES)
189155.description:
Futari Machi ("Two people town") is a 2-player game of town development.

You and your partner are assigned to do development planning for two towns that are separated by a river respectively. Let’s build colorful buildings and make a charming town to attract many residents to your own town. For example, students like to have more entertainment areas and marathon runners desire longer roads. A pair of twin babies may turn up in a town with excellent environment.

The player who has gained the most residents is the winner.

189157.name: A Very Krampus Christmas
189157.description:
From publisher blurb:

Krampus. The Christmas Demon. The Bringer of Yuletide Punishment. “Vern”. This oft-misunderstood character predates even Santa, and his tale of woe is a stark reminder that no good deed goes unpunished.

This FREE SUPPLEMENT to the holiday favorite Santa's Soldiers RPG gives game masters a profile and stats for the Krampus character, as well as a six-part mission seed. Jazz up your holiday game sessions with A Very Krampus Christmas!

189158.name: Post-Apocalyptic Shelter
189158.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 16 inch by 20 inch, floor plan of a Post-Apocalyptic Shelter , with Hex, Square and No overlay.

The PDF includes includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“Damned irradiated acid rain keeps coming down. Took out most of the shed already and keeps dissolving parts of the wall. Only a matter of time now till this shelter crumbles or the mutants come crashing through the walls again and we have to risk finding a new shelter.”—Post-Apocalyptic Survivor

Post-Apocalyptic Shelter is a small map of an exterior wasteland and the interior of a small house in the center.

Post-Apocalyptic Shelter is intended for use in post-apocalyptic survival, horror, or modern games.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Death Rain: After World War III, the world was engulfed in nuclear winter killing most of the world’s plant life from a combination of cold and blocking of the sun, leaving the Earth a barren rock. Then the nuclear summer made the temperature shoot up and the nuclear snow turned to irradiated acid rain. The polar ice caps melted and the coasts were submerged completely. The last few survivors await the end in the few remaining shelters in the deserts, as the changing weather moves the rain even into previous arid areas of the world.

189159.name: In the Bleak Midsummer
189159.description:
From publisher blurb:

Just when you thought that the British weather couldn’t possibly get any worse...

London is suffering from the worst weather in recorded history – and for the capital of her Majesty’s Empire of Steam, that’s really quite an impressive feat. Not only is the centre of the city gripped by unseasonably cold snap, but a strange new species of robin (or something that looks very much like one) appears to have taken up residence. Yet what does any of this have to do with a commission from the Royal Zoological Society, a disappearing toymaker and a positive surfeit of mince pies?

In the Bleak Midsummer is a short, seasonally-themed (well, mostly) adventure for the Cogs, Cakes and Swordsticks roleplaying game of steampunk pulp adventure. As well as the scenario, the book also contains four pre-generated characters, a rival for the Ministry of Computational Sciences and hooks for further “chilling” adventuring!

189160.name: Top That!
189160.description:
Each player in Top That! has five wooden bits before them: a black hat, orange tube, red goblet, green coin, and white rabbit. Shuffle the deck of sixty challenge cards, then reveal one of them. Players race to stack their pieces following two rules:


Whichever pieces on the revealed card are in their original color must be visible in the stack.
Whichever pieces are shown in grey must be hidden somewhere within the stack.


Whoever does this first claims the card, and whoever first claims a certain number of cards wins the game!

189161.name: The Hot Seat
189161.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1524; Stage One: Mark Redacted; Stage Two: J Groves; Stage Three: Jonathan Hansen




From the Introduction:

This is a game about corporate culture, with a supernatural premise to exaggerate the satire. Players take on the role of new hires at Tapewood, Scrimshaw, and Scry-Wyrm Inc. As the most profitable and prestigious corporation in the world, competition for jobs at TS&S is rabid.

What new hires quickly discover, however, is that TS&S owes its soaring success to shareholders who are not of this Earth. Survival at TS&S demands appeasing Those Below. That in turn demands sacrificing something of one's humanity in the process.

The competition only heats up once you become an employee. Sales drudges through the worst corporate daily grind imaginable but enjoys a brotherhood in their suffering that the overlords in Management and Legal can only envy. Management flaunts their incredible wealth and prestige without shame, and yet depend on the inhuman machinations of Marketing and the cold robotic calculus of Accounting for that wealth. Human Resources has eyes and ears everywhere, and only the inhumanly strong survive in the bowels of Distrbution's warehouses. Every facet of "the Company" schemes against every other unless an outside force threatens to impinge on the bottom line. Then it's all hands to battle stations as TS&S unleashes the full fury of its power in white collar warfare.

Fortunately, one cannot actually die in a Hot Seat game. Unfortunately, there are many things in the corporate world far worse than death. Unsatisfactory performance can lead to termination, resulting in any number of terrible consequences for the hapless former employee. Left to drool in a mental hospital with a lobotomized memory, stranded in Mexican gang territory with only a severance package and no clothes, or "picked up" by a rival corporation and….forcibly volunteered to elicit TS&S's company secrets are all possible, and much more.

189162.name: Space Problems Argh
189162.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1525; Stage One: Vincent Baker; Stage Two: Dave Ring; Stage Three: Dean Picozzi

189163.name: Last Year's Magic
189163.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1527; Stage One: Sean Smith; Stage Two: Dan Maruschak; Stage Three: Jason Dettman




From the Introduction:
This is a game about people with a fondness for the little-known and obscure, who present themselves with ostentatious affectations in their manner of speech and dress, and are sometimes seen with eye-catching facial hair: Wizards.

There is a fundamental truth about magic: it doesn't work for everybody. In fact, if it worked for everybody it wouldn't be magic, it would just be normal. Here's another fundamental truth: wizardly magic is based on knowledge. You have to know things about spiritual power, the deep structure of the universe, the connections among things, and the imposition of will upon reality. Naturally, in concordance with the first fundamental truth, this knowledge wouldn't be magical if everybody knew it. As such, wizards prize esoteric knowledge that sets them apart from the rest of society. Of course, some people merely pretend to have knowledge instead of actually possessing it. What separates a real wizard from a charlatan is that they know real stuff, they're not just making it up. As such, it's important to most wizards that they let you know what they know, so you can tell they're a real wizard who knows stuff that's worth knowing.

Each of you is playing a wizard who has chosen to spend the evening in pub that's well-known (among those who are in-the-know) for its exquisitely authentic local flavor. As often happens when wizards gather, however, your evening is beset by problems. But there are two sides to every coin, because for every problem is also an opportunity for you to explain how best to solve it. And, as luck would have it, there are several other wizards in the pub: exactly the sort of people who can fully appreciate your expertise.

189164.name: The Clinic
189164.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1528; Stage One: Mischa Krilov; Stage Two: Robert Bohl; Stage Three: Nick Wedig
Stage One Title: Adventures at the Dresden-Potter Magical Medical Teaching Hospital
Stage Two Title: The Automatic Limes




From the Introduction/Prologue:
This is a game about people who have been abducted from their normal lives, had their memories fucked with, and are now being subjected to experiments by mysterious beings for unknown purposes.

The Clinic
You are trapped in an unfamiliar location referred to as “the Clinic”. This facility models itself after a hospita, but it is not what it seems. The PCs and other patients are referred to as “Subjects”. Subjects undergo treatments and experimentation while in the Clinic. Under no circumstances are Subjects allowed to leave the Clinic. All entrances and exits are closely monitored by the Staff.

189165.name: Pickomino - the dice game by Reiner Knizia
189165.description:
"Barbecued worms are in high demand, and only the coolest-headed chicken can win the tasty snack! But beware: Anyone who doesn't manage to grab a worm off the grill can help himself to those on his opponents' plates!

In Reiner Knizia’s popular dice game, 16 barbecue worm portions with different values are waiting on the grill to be snatched up by the dice-throwing chickens. The rules are simple, but don’t push your luck too far: To get your claws into one of the delicious worms, you roll all 8 dice at the same time. You then pick a value from your throw and remove all the dice showing the same value, before throwing the remaining dice again. If your score corresponds to an available barbecue worm portion on the grill you can take this portion - or maybe even grab a portion from the plate of your fellow players! You’ll need both the luck of the dice and the right strategy: Stick with your score, or roll the dice just one more time to get a better portion.

The player with the most worms in his claws at the end of the game wins!"

Source: The Developer Website.

189166.description:
Description from the publisher:

Strange things are afoot in Bill & Ted's Excellent Boardgame!

Collect personages of historical significance in order to pass your oral history report. But beware! Every time you bag someone, the phone booth breaks most-heinously, and your adventure through time will take a most serious turn!

Be excellent to each other...and party on, dudes!
189166.name: Bill & Ted's Excellent Boardgame
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 022 – Origins 2016
Episode 4 - A New Hope (Gen Con Preview)
Gen Con Day 1 Recap

189167.name: Psychic Detective Agency
189167.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1529; Stage One: Jay Treat; Stage Two: Eric Nieudan; Stage Three: Willow Palacek




From the Introduction:
You sense things no one else can. And you use your gift to help the authorities catch dangerous criminals. Today you’re teaming up with other consultants with mysterious talents, despite your many differences. What twisted plot demands the collaboration of such odd detectives?

Psychic Detective Agency is an American Freeform game for 2 or more players, based on improv fundamentals. Take on the role of psychic detectives, and shape the story together. Your characters might see the end coming, but you never will.

What is American Freeform? It's sort of like Live Action Roleplay (Larp), crossed with improv, and generally focused on intense, single session games. You'll know it when you see it.

Gameplay: As a group, you create the story together by answering Questions and then playing out scenes. Anyone may prompt a Question at any time. Players are not restricted to narrating or roleplaying only when prompted, but have greater narrative authority when answering a Question.

189168.name: Disney's Villains' Revenge
videogamehonor: 2000 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Nominee
2000 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
189168.description:
The game's story is set in the bedroom of the player, presumably a child. Jiminy Cricket is the guardian of a book in the player's room which features several stories with happy endings. However, the book's happy ending pages are ripped out by a very bored Jiminy Cricket, who has read them so often that they put him to sleep.

Source: Wikipedia, "Disney's Villains' Revenge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189169.description:
Description from the publisher:

Journey northwards and take your place among the knights, lords, and ladies of House Stark with Wolves of the North, the first deluxe expansion to be released for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition).

In this expansion, House Stark takes the spotlight as they gain new cards to guide your Stark decks in new and unexpected directions. You may use Direwolves to cow and overpower your foes, rush to victory with the aid of House Tully, or draw strength from the Winter itself. Throughout the box, you’ll find new versions of iconic characters like Eddard Stark, Catelyn Stark, Jon Snow, and Arya Stark, alongside characters entering the game for the first time, including The Blackfish, Shaggydog, and Rickon Stark.
189169.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Wolves of the North
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Good The Board and The Joe Likes Space Alert Way Too Much: Episode 77 “Programming Games”

189170.name: Clusterball
videogamehonor: 2001 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Nominee
189170.description:
In Clusterball the player must collect as many balls as they can from the playing field then fly them through a ring in the center of the stage to collect points. Various weapons and power ups are strewn around the stages, enabling players to steal their opponents' balls or invert the controls of the other player, making movement much more difficult. The balls lie on magnetic ramps and the aircraft must slide on these ramps to collect the balls. As the player tows more and more balls, which create a tail behind the aircraft, the aircraft becomes gradually heavier, therefore more vulnerable to enemy attacks.

Source: Wikipedia, "Clusterball", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189171.name: Links 2001
videogamehonor: 2001 D.I.C.E. Simulation Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
2001 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
189171.description:
User Summary

Links 2001 is a golfing game.

189172.name: Murder
189172.description:
User Summary

A short point and click short story taking place in a cyberpunk setting.

189173.name: Asheron's Call - Dark Majesty
videogamehonor: 2002 D.I.C.E. Massively Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
189173.description:
User Summary

The expansion adds a new island called Marae Lassel that will have areas for all levels of characters. Player housing and personal storage will be introduced, with about one thousand pre-built houses per game world. Four new, major monsters types will be introduced.

189174.name: Scan Command: Jurassic Park
videogamehonor: 2002 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
189174.description:
User Summary

You command a dinosaur and build its energy, strength, and other abilities by adding DNA via the real-life barcode scanner provided with the game. The scanner can read almost any type of barcode and it beeps when it collects DNA power-ups that can be used for your in-game dinosaur.

You must guide your DNA skill enhanced dinosaur through ruined laboratories, swamps, and inside a volcano to defeat the villain, Dr. Corts. Several dinosaur enemies and puzzles must be overcome by using the right mix of DNA power-ups, collected by scanning barcodes from common household products in your home or the grocery store. Once you collect DNA, you upload it to the game and decide how to boost or enhance your Velociraptor's, T-Rex's, or Spinosaurus' skills to complete missions.

189176.name: Nimemäng
189176.description:
"Name game" in English is card game of popular family names.
There are 200 common names from 40 countries in this game.

The player who name first the country where the name is common gets the card as a point. Who has the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

189177.description: Metal command figure sets exclusive to Kickstarter now available for purchase separately. Extra set of 8 x 15mm (1/100th scale) metal Generals miniatures.
189177.name: The Great War: Metal General Figures

189178.description: Set of custom combat dice from the core game that can be purchased separately from the Publisher
189178.name: The Great War: Commands and Colours Dice Set

189181.name: Toontown Online
videogamehonor: 2003 D.I.C.E. Massively Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
189181.description:
Toontown Online‍ '​s story centered on an ongoing battle between a population of cartoon animals known as the Toons and a collection of business-minded robots known as the Cogs who are trying to take over the town. Players would choose and customise their own toon and go on to complete Toontasks, play mini-games, and fight the Cogs.

Source: Wikipedia, "Toontown Online", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189182.name: State Smarts: The Card Game of National Intelligence
189182.description:
From the publisher:

State Smarts is a U.S. geography card game that is both educational and fun for children yet is also entertaining and challenging enough for adults. In addition to state specific facts, kids will also learn unique characteristics about each region of the country. The game also teaches state and landmark location as well as state abbreviations.

State Smarts is more than just a game of learning, it’s also a competitive game of strategy that the whole family can enjoy. Experienced players that have familiarized themselves with the facts will quickly appreciate the element of probability that makes playing State Smarts™ so much fun.

State Smarts is a simple card game that is easy to learn and a game that can be played anywhere. There are 100 cards in the deck with about 70 different original illustrations. A game of State Smarts should last about 15-20 minutes.

189184.description:
A swift brutal cardgame for two players. Plenty of luck, plenty of influence -and plenty of bullets.

The game is about getting control of the different districts of Chicago. The player with the most victory points at the end of the third round wins.

At the beginning of each round place three district cards in a line in the middle of the table.

Then each player draws seven gangster card and take turn placing them by the districts. When each player has placed two gangsters in each district the shooting begins.

The shooting happens in three phases, your gangster card shows if your gangsters can shoot in each phase, in which direction the gangster can shoot and if he can dodge a bullet from any of the directions. If shot three times the gangster is killed and is removed at the end of that phases.

When all bullets are fired and the three phases has ended, you determine which player has the most influencial gangsters in each district (the most family points). The players then take each of the districts they now control.

At the end of the game the player with the most victory points win. Victory point are shown on the district cards.
189184.name: Chicago Shootout

189185.name: The Lands of Marak
189185.description:
From the introduction:

The Lands of Marak are named after the Navigator Marak, who brought the Pale Folk to the Realm of the Pure Lands, through the maelstroms of the Shimmering Ocean nine generations ago. A visionary in his youth, Marak grew corrupt in his old age - his Navigators were overthrown four generations ago, exiled to the Ice Flats to the north.

Since the rebellion, the Pale Folk have generally frowned on magic use.

Marak had likely never visited most of the Realms in the Sphere that bears his name, but the Pale Folk still identify with him, despite ousting him. The Unity Covenant that the Dukes of the Pure Lands signed after overthrowing Marak has since been expanded - there are now Duchies in the nearby territory of Derange, and even some Pale Folk settlements in Santana and on the eastern slopes of the Lofty Mountains.

The Realms of Derange, Santana, and the Lofty Mountains are where the Red Men make their homes. The Red Men are a strange folk, aboriginal to the Sphere and highly steeped in magic, having been around even longer than the theandria of the Mixed Lands. They do not speak the Tongue, instead speaking a shattered language that differs from clan to clan, village to village. (Santana is a word from the Red Men - those from the Pure Lands often call it the Frontier, a word that Santanans have come to associate with 'greenhorns'.)

The people of the Mixed Lands (known as the Jaguar People) speak the Tongue, although a very strange dialect, full of obscure words and hidden meanings. They are ruled by a 'theandric', a person said to be simultaneously divine and human. Succession is more or less through divine fiat.

Beyond the Lofty Mountains, there is the Golden Coast, lying on the Peaceful Ocean. Not much is known about the inhabitants. Similarly, to the south of the Mixed Lands is the Umbral Jungle, a land that even the Jaguar People speak of in hushed tones, full of awe and horror.

189186.name: Sublevel Zero
189186.description:
Sublevel Zero is a first-person roguelite six-degree-of-freedom shooter set in a universe where reality is falling apart. Take control of a lone gunship pilot whose mission is to loot and craft ancient technology. Descend into a vast underground facility, fighting through procedurally generated zero gravity environments to recover the technology you and your clan need to survive.

Source: GOG.

189187.name: UnderWorld: Bermuda Triangle
189187.description:
UnderWorld interpreted in a non-urban setting.

From the introduction:

Beneath the surface of the Atlantic Ocean and the Caribbean Sea, in the area commonly known as the Bermuda Triangle, the ruins of Atlantis lie buried. Protected and obscured by twelve thousand years of sediment and erosion, the ruins lie in a hostile place - dark, cold, and filled with enough pressure to crush an unprotected man like a paper cup.

Yet there is civilization in the deep, people living off the remains of the past and the rubbish of the present, hiding in air-filled pockets resulting from varying combinations of natural formation, elbow grease, and secret Atlantean knowledge. They trade and war with one another, with the Tritons who sacrificed their humanity for fins and gills, all unknown to the surface.

189188.name: Vikerkaar minu kõhus
189188.description:
Vikerkaar minu kõhus ("Rainbow in my stomah") is a board game about healthy diet for children.

There are different vegetables, fruits and berries, proteins juice and grain cards in different colors on the cards.
Player try to get points by collecting 3 cards with different colors + protein, juice and grain cards.
Additionally player may be awarded with bonus points by cooking, helping clean the kitchen etc.

The player who has the most points when the deck is exhausted wins the game.

189189.name: Colt Express: North Pole Station
189189.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 3.

A single card of the stop type: North Pole Station

At the end of the game, each bandit gives his highest purse to the imp.

189191.name: S.A.V.A.G.E. Essentials
189191.description:
Survival And Victory After Global Extinction

From the introduction:

This is the Essentials version of S.A.V.A.G.E., meaning it has been stripped down to the core rules only. Artwork is minimal, layout is basic, and it does not include a campaign setting, bestiary, artifact listing, or pre-made adventure that you will find in the full version of the rules. What this does have is all you need to play the game, including a character sheet and the full guidelines for weapon creation.

It should be noted that this game is for experienced gamers only, as the rules are very detailed and are meant to add an element of realism, flexibility, and squad level tactics to the gaming experience.

189192.description:
Mi Tierra: New Era (My Land: New Era) is a worker placement game in which the players represent farmers that try to labor their land in the best way possible. They will have to sow and work the land and take care of their animals so they can produce goods and sell them in the different available markets.

In this second edition, players will have all the fun included in the original Mi Tierra plus more, since the second edition includes many more features like use of water for plantations, horses, new products and more. Also, instead of four players you will be able to play up to six-player games. Finally, the rules of the game have been revised to make sure that Mi Tierra gets even better.
189192.name: Mi Tierra: New Era
boardgamepodcastepisode: 6. Devon Dice podcast, The Castles of Burgundy review

189193.name: Otsukimi Fukurou
189193.description:
おつきみふくろう (Moon Viewing Owls)

In a forest where no one knows about, there are owls that are kind of unusual, who are anxiously waiting for the perfectly round full Moon.

“Let’s go view the Moon tonight”
The owls work very, very hard to prepare for the dango.

However, the dango are so delicious, tempting the owls to steal and eat them when no one knows about.

Original description:

こっそりどこかにある森で、
ちょっと変わったふくろうたちが、
待ち遠しいのは、まんまるまんぷくおつきさま。

「今宵は皆でお月見じゃ」
ふくろうたちは、せっせ、せっせとお団子準備。

だけども、お団子おいしそう。
ちょっとだけの出来心。
こっそり盗んで食べちゃおう

189194.description:
This is the 5th in a series of Annual Games Unlimited Holiday Games and is the followup to Gameshop Express (2011), Gameshop Workday (2012), Gameshop Gladiators (2013), and Gameshop Adventurers (2014)

This expansions adds:

an additional map card to Gameshop Express

an alternate "3" card for Gameshop Workday

a new gladiator class - the Party Gamer - for Gameshop Gladiators

and two new characters - The Cleric and The Thief - for Gameshop Adventurers
189194.name: Gameshop Expansions

189195.name: Party Boss
189195.description:
In Party Boss, take on the role of the backroom political operative guiding the strategy of one of America's great political parties. Nominate your cronies to challenge incumbents and manage their campaigns. You decide where your party's vast resources will be concentrated. Will your efforts to influence the electorate succeed?

Once your politicians have taken office, plot your legislative strategy for the term: select the bills to bring to the floor and how you will go about passing them. Will you use the brute force of your majority, or the crafty tactics of backroom deals and parliamentary maneuvers?

At the end of 5 cycles, the boss with the most impact on American governance wins, while the other must retire in obscurity.

189197.description: The mighty Chaos Dragon is sowing chaos into the city of Arcadia. The laws of nature hardly apply, and the very fabric of reality that holds the realm together threatens to unravel. The guilds of Arcadia will need an uneasy truce between them in order to take down this magnificent chaotic foe!
189197.name: Arcadia Quest: Chaos Dragon

189198.name: Pisswhistle
189198.description:
Combination card-dice game created to use items in the Ashens Game fan merchandise pack, but playable with regular pieces.

Played in two phases. In the first two phases, players play cards against each other with the highest card being added to the player's War Chest, giving a points score which is carried over to the final "battle" phase in which players reduce each others scores via the roll of a die until one player's score is exhausted.

The game's name is Norfolk slang for male genitalia.

189199.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 4.

A cardboard punch out of a slot machine.

The slot machine is treated as the seventh casino, but with slightly different rules for dice placement.

The rules are the same as for the slot machine card in Las Vegas Boulevard.
189199.name: Las Vegas: The Slot Machine

189200.name: Winit
189200.description:
From the box box:

Using the dice, roll numbers which give you a choice of letters from the spiral to build 3, 4, and 5 letter words. Each player has his own playing board, trying to get highest score, based on word and letter values. A competitive, educational crossword game.

189201.name: Dark Agent
189201.description:
At the head of a secret service, you use your spy satellites (tokens of your color) to coordinate attacks on targets that you designate to your agents :
- Objectives (tiger), Sentinel (gray), enemies Agents (their color), or the Dark Agent (black), you win all their victory points when capturing them and place them in front of you;
- Equipment (object in a white disk), one shot, are taken over to be used and discarded later;
- Special actions (red with no points) Are resolved immediately and remain in place.

One or more of your agents can attack a target only if your satellites lets you see both agents and target.

When players have had them all, the number of captured aims agreed early in the game (2 to 5 on the 5 available), it ends. You can add the capture of the Dark Agent as a further condition endgame.

The player accumulating the most points wins. He adds the points of his agents still on the theater of operation. Also note that each time a player wins an aim, he takes the bonus +3 token to its previous owner.

189202.description:
A third-party, unofficial parody expansion pack.

Includes 150 brand new, original cards (130 absurd white cards & 20 ludicrous black cards)
189202.name: Carps & Angsty Manatee: Volume 1

189203.name: Le Dernier Peuple
189203.description:
Le Dernier Peuple ("The Last People") is a simple, quick card game for 3 to 5 players from France.

In Le Dernier Peuple, you personify a people.

Each player has a "home" card which of his/her color. You play cards to move your 2 meeples around the cards's circle and gain points.

First, you can (optional action) use a power card (those cards are collected on pickaxes). Each card has a unique effect - read it by hovering the card in your hand with your mouse.

Secondly, you have to chose between drawing 2 movement cards OR use 1 movement card then draw 1 movement card. A grey downward arrow allows you to move your meeple ; a black upward arrow allows you to move any opponent's meeple. Each arrow gives 2 possibilities : moving a meeple by the number indicated in the circle (positive = clockwise ; negative = unclockwise) OR moving a meeple toward the card with the number indicated in the square.

You'll gain points by surrounding any "home" card with your 2 meeples or with 1 of your meeple and one opponent's meeple.
The goal is to be the first to reach 12 points.

The game is online playable at Boardgamearena.

189204.name: Mighty Dungeons
189204.description:
User Summary

A cross between an old-style RPG dungeon crawl and a video presentation, you choose a character, fight monsters, and gain loot.

189205.name: RHAD Rules
189205.description:
From the introduction:

The RHAD Rules are an alternative system of rules the Red Hook Autoduellists adopted back in the early 90's to make handling count for something and yet not sog down an evening with its mess of details. The RHAD Rules are quick and simple yet still carry Car War's treasured feel of realism.

User summary:

The RHAD Rules are intended to replace the turning, drift, and crash rules from the base game with streamlined rules. The new rules are purely mechanical with no roleplaying alterations.

189206.name: ToAD: Tales of Adventure (1st Edition)
189206.description:
User summary:

ToAD presents itself as "a Model Reality Kit - not a model for reality but a model of reality". The rules are intended to enable role-playing in nearly any genre through they are written with a strong fantasy slant and the sample adventure is definitively high fantasy.

Characters have many typical role-playing aspects, including race, sex, Abilities, description, and so forth. Skills in the system are referred to as Preoccupations, which are particular Skills the characters finds compelling over the long term. Preoccupations are somewhat like Skills that develop over time, loosely analogous to a more traditional Class though more freeform. Preoccupations have several dimensions that control performance. Combat is generally simple in concept but numerous special situations add complexity.

189207.name: Catch Submarines
189207.description:
Dexterity game for kids (fine motor skill and perspective skill).

30 Submarines in 6 colors, A grid built from 9 limiting snakes, 2 tweezers, and the game box itself as the board.

Each turn, the player roll the die to see which submarine s/he need to pull this turn (with the tweezers), however, the task isn't simple, as a grid of snakes block the way and the player most pull the submarine without moving the snakes (if the player accidentally moves any of the snakes, the turn is over).

The player with the most submarines at the end of the game wins.

189208.name: Player's Handbook (4th Edition)
189208.description:
From the manual:

The ToAd is a Role Playing Game. This means that there is a big story at hand and you are controlling the destiny of a character in it. You don't actually have to act or pronounce the character's lines if you don't want to. However, you will need to let everyone know the difference between what you are saying and what your character is saying. Try tacking a "Shamrock says," onto the front of whatever she says when it feels necessary.

You also have to let Shamrock be Shamrock. If you know that the Earth circles the Sun while Shamrock believes that it rides across the sky on the back of a giant dragon then you have to play by her world not yours. In the adventure there will be challenges and intrigue and mystery and wonder. Mostly though there will be lots of combat.

User summary:

The Player's Handbook (4th Edition) contains the entire game rules; this manual is analogous to the ToAD: Tales of Adventure (1st Edition) manual in scope.

189209.name: ToAD Character Sheets (1st Edition)
189209.description:
User summary:

Five versions of the ToAD (1st Edition) character sheet were provided for free download. Each version consisted of three pages and they were all identical except for background color.

189210.name: Alien Crash Site
189210.description:
Alien Crash Site is a family friendly, 2 - 4 player co-op game for ages 12+. Play lasts about 60 minutes.

A UFO has crashed in the middle of the board and Aliens are pouring out! On the outskirts of town stand your Nuke plant, Water reservoir, Hospital, and Communications tower. If the Aliens destroy some of these key locations, it's 'game over'!

In order to prevent this from happening you will need to work together to unveil ultra high tech defenses, devise master strategies, build and command forces, and - hopefully - gain access to the ultimate weapon!

Unlike other co-op games, each player controls only 1 section of the board. There will be times of calm and times of sheer panic during play.

189211.name: High Seize
videogamehonor: 2006 D.I.C.E. Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
189211.description:
A retired navy captain is forced return to his swashbuckling days, as his father is kidnapped by a notorious pirate. As events unfolds, the captain has to hunt for mythical treasures and take on the most feared of all pirates, Black Barlow.

Source: Wikipedia, "High Seize", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189212.name: Skipping Stone
videogamehonor: 2006 D.I.C.E. Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
189212.description:
User Summary

Skipping Stone is a one-button game where the player throws a stone, to have it skip as far as possible across a lake. The game has two modes; distance and splash. In distance mode players skip it as far as possible, while in splash mode players get it to splash as many times as possible.

189213.name: Big Wheel
189213.description:
From the publisher:
