Big Wheel challenges the skills, luck and determination of 1-8 players, pitting players against players and against the board itself! The object of the game: to become a millionaire (or go broke) within the time allotted. Easily understood directions. Educational and fun for the entire family - year 'round!

Big Wheel uses a patented movement which changes the economic conditions of the gameboard randomly among depression, recession, normal, inflation and super-inflation. As a result players must change their strategy as the gameboard changes.

189214.name: Cartel (Ashcan Edition)
189214.description:
From the back of the book

The Sinaloa Cartel is the largest drug trafficking organization in the world, a sprawling network of narcos, halcones, y sicarias that moves billions of dollars of drugs into Los Estados Unidos each year. One of their prime holdings is Durango, Mexico, a small city ten hours south of the border that’s a crucial way station for anything moving north.

But holding the city ain’t easy: either La policía gets in the way, or some foolish pendejo thinks he can pull one over on the chingados that run Durango for los jefes grande. And don’t even get me started on Los Zetas...

You want in, cabrón? Fine by me. Just know that once you’re in... there’s no turning back.

From the publisher

Magpie Games is proud to announce the release of Cartel: Ashcan Edition at GenCon 2015. This 48-page rulebook contains everything you need to run sessions of Cartel, including setting information, playbooks, and MC advice!

189215.name: Digiworld
189215.description:
User summary:

Digiworld is a rules-light role-playing game that adapts the Digimom: Digital Monsters media franchise to the table-top. Players in the game assume the roles of characters that are able to interact with "digital monsters" that come from an alternate, digital, dimension (often by traveling to that dimension from our own).

Characters have Attributes (Strength, Athletics, Toughness, Charm, Genius, Smarts, and Heart). Each Attribute has an associated dice pool of D6 that are rolled whenever that Attribute is used in a contested action. Within the "digital world" everything is built of seven Elements: Fire, Water, Thunder, Earth, Wind, Light, and Dark. Each character specializes in one of these Elements. Elements are considered "strong" against one other elements, "weak" against one other, and "normal" against the remainder. Damage taken from "strong" or "weak" elements is increased or decreased, respectively.

189216.name: World Wide Wrestling: The Roleplaying Game
189216.description:
From the book

The World Wide Wrestling RPG is a game that creates professional wrestling pageantry and action. It’s about feuds, championships, betrayal, and righteous victory. It’s about the clash of good and evil on the grandest stage. It’s about whether you’ve got what it takes. And, in the end, it’s about what the audience thinks of your efforts.

Additional Information

This is the main rule book for the game.

It is powered by Apocalypse Engine.

189217.name: Bluffing Fighter
189217.description: In Bluffing Fighter, the player superheroes compete against one another to see who outlast everyone else.

189218.name: 曼荼羅 (Mandara)
189218.description:
Mandala is type of painting that represents the Buddhist interpretation of the appearance of the universe. Various mandalas are painted to embody the beliefs of Buddhism, even in Japan, ancient artifacts from the Asuka period (550-710 CE) have been left behind. In this game, the players are mandala painters working together to paint a single mandala while competing against each other’s skills. The completion of a mandala painting is accompanied by huge suffering; the painters’ minds wander in six types of world of indecision that are called the six realms. The player who makes the most splendid contribution to the completion of mandala throughout the game to express that belief will win the game.

Note: The six realms is a Buddhist concept. It includes Deva realm, Asura realm, Human realm, Animal realm, Hungry Ghost realm, Naraka realm, which are represented by the 6 cards in this game.

189219.description:
The fifth expansion for Heart of Crown. It requires either the base set or the Fairy Garden expansion to play and may be integrated with the other Heart of Crown expansions.

The set contains 72 cards:

1 new Princess
2 new Support cards
10 new types of Common Card (5 of each type plus randomizer)
Completely revised versions of 8 support cards from the Six City Alliance expansion
1 placeholder card for the pile of Exiled cards
189219.name: Heart of Crown: Path Before Heaven

189220.name: Lost Reavers
189220.description:
User summary

Lost Reavers is a "pay to play" online small-team multiplayer coop game. Four players team up to raid a small grave or ruin in search of a Relic, which is supposed to act as an energy source, and carry it back to the starting point.

In the ways stands zombies, mummies, and the players also have to avoid traps, move things and pick locks in order to proceed.

There are four available characters; the player is free to choose, and a team may consist of four identical characters. Each character levels up independently and the player can distribute skill points to improve the character.

Weapons and upgrades can also be bought by ingame medals or real money.

189221.name: Kingdom of Emélrenè
189221.description:
Emélrenè is the last great Járind realm of Venârivè. The kingdom has existed for over fourteen centuries, and it has held back invaders as powerful as the Empire of Ázeryàn. Yet the dangers within the kingdom’s borders are far greater than any external threat, and the rulers of the realm are increasingly concerned as warning signs grow.

Has the day of reckoning come for the kingdom of the Eméla?

This comprehensive module includes the following sections:

Overview of the geography, climate, ecology and population of the realm.
Information on the unique and dangerous ethereal environment of the region.
Natural and supernatural flora and fauna.
History of the Eméla people.
Culture, including an in-depth look at the Emélan view of the world, key annual events, and the arts and cuisine of the realm.
Folklore, identifying major myths and legends.
Society, a detailed exploration of the complex social structure of Emélrenè, including the unique social class of the Émhlè or 'Free Eméla'.
Religion, covering both the unique Cult of the Covenant, as well as the local forms of worship of the Kéthrian gods.
Arcane Societies, providing information on the significant number of such organisations within the realm, and their particular roles and activities.
Government, providing detailed information on leading individuals, the royal court, the Emélan Council, the Order of the Ebon Pearl, royal office holders, as well as town and feudal government.
Emélan Diplomacy, an introduction to the numerous foreign activities of the Emélan state.
Military Forces, providing information on standing forces, as well as militias and the great annual feudal musters, with their associated tournaments and fairs.
Economy, broad information on trade, products, coinage, fairs and markets.
Towns and Settlements - detailed information on 130 major settlements and locations, organised by shire.
Additional reference material: religious holdings, special locations, Émhlè ranges and clans, class, ethnicity and religious affiliation, military statistics, key dates, Emélan noble honorifics, common Emélan names, a list of great clans, and finally an extensive glossary of Emélan words.
(Publisher blurb)

boardgamehonor: 2017 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Multiplayer) Nominee
189222.description:
The Earth has dried out and civilization with it. Some of the survivors have managed to eke out a living on the Saltlands: plains left behind by a once great ocean. Adapting to their environment they use land sails with wheels on these flats. But the Apocalypse is not done with the Saltlands, from the west a storm of raiders, a terrifying Horde on gas guzzling machines approaches in search of their lost God. Only those among the first to escape have a chance!

In Saltlands, the first group of players to find and reach an exit point wins, leaving the rest to the Horde. There are no fixed teams, players can decide to co-operate or backstab each other as they see fit. Each player starts the game with a single captain but may increase his crew as the game progresses. Each crew member represents an extra life and an action each turn. Players move with their land sails according to the wind direction: being able to criss-cross slowly upwind or speed in the fastest direction, sailing on a broad reach. Each player can choose which group of raiders to move at the end of their turn until all raiders have moved. This allows players to help each other or force confrontation with the raiders. Players can fight the raiders and take their vehicles as an alternate mode of transport.
189222.name: Saltlands

189223.name: Into Shadow
rpg: Savage Kingdoms: Heroic Sword and Sorcery Roleplaying
189223.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Savage Kingdoms adventure recommended for 3-4 player-characters of mid-to-high Advancement (7-10). Herein, a Sidhe lord engages a band of mighty adventurers to help find a relic from a bygone age anddestroy it before it re-ignites a deadly conflict betweenthe Eluna Sidhe and the Dark Sidhe. However,an evil Eluna Dol priestess stands in the way, wishing to acquire the relic for herself. And a deadly and mysterious plague awaits the heroes far to the south in the great Empire of Lorinthia.

189224.name: Blood Feast
189224.description:
From publisher blurb:

A band of adventurers take refuge from a thunderstorm in the warm confines of an upscale inn only to awaken with mysterious pulsating sores — and a growing thirst for fresh blood.

Blood Feast is a one-shot fantasy/horror adventure for the FIFTH EDITION of the most famous roleplaying game of all time. Play-time is approximately four hours.

An adventuring party of five 7th level heroes with at least one cleric or druid is required to play.

The following OGL Open Game Content is also included:

One new artifact
Two new monsters
Five pre-generated 7th level heroes




The Blood Feast adventure is the great way to experience mid-level FIFTH EDITION game play or as a deadly drop-in-play scenerio for an ongoing campaign.

189225.name: Amethyst: Untamed – Player's Guide
189225.description:
From publisher blurb:

Which side will you choose? Which weapons will you wield? Earth is torn between the order of science and the chaos of fantasy. These two worlds cannot mix. Venture into lands once claimed by skyscrapers and factories, now overrun by elves, goblins, and dragons. Choose your path and commit to the quest. Monsters will hunt you; machines will track you. No gods will help you; no prophecies will choose you. The fate of the world rests with you.

The critically acclaimed Amethyst setting, now for the Savage Worlds Roleplaying Game.

This rulebook contains everything a player needs to create Savage Worlds characters for Amethyst, including:

Eleven new playable species.
New and altered edges and hindrances.
High-tech equipment from revolvers to railcannons, pickup trucks to powered armor.
An introduction to the cultures and dangers of the world of Amethyst.
Dozens of character archetypes to get you playing right away.

189226.name: Amethyst: Untamed – World Guide
189226.description:
From publisher blurb:

Which side will you choose? Which weapons will you wield? Earth is torn between the order of science and the chaos of fantasy. These two worlds cannot mix. Venture into lands once claimed by skyscrapers and factories, now overrun by elves, goblins, and dragons. Choose your path and commit to the quest. Monsters will hunt you; machines will track you. No gods will help you; no prophecies will choose you. The fate of the world rests with you.

The critically acclaimed Amethyst setting, now for the Savage Worlds Roleplaying Game.

This setting guide contains everything a GM needs to run Amethyst games in savage worlds, including:

A gazetteer of the setting, told from the perspective of one of its most well-traveled residents.
Dozens of plot hooks to guide your adventures.
A medley of menacing monsters.
An introductory adventure to kick-start your epic journey.

189227.name: Occultists
189227.description:
From publisher blurb:

Masters of the Occult!

Occult Character Codex: Occultists contains 20 detailed occultist stat blocks, including both ordinary occultists with an array of implements as well as lich-loving necroccultists dabbling with the dead! You'll find occultist humans, gnomes, half-orcs, and elves, but also stranger races like hobgoblins, tieflings, ratfolk, and wayangs, running the gamut from good to evil and all points in between. With the Occult Character Codex, you'll have an entire arsenal of occultist characters waiting and ready to blow your players' minds!

189228.name: Spiritualists
189228.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Spirits Have Awakened!

Occult Character Codex: Spiritualists contains 20 detailed spiritualist stat blocks, including a phantom for each and every one, for a total of 40 unique creatures and characters! The spiritualists tap into the power of raw unbridled emotion through their phantoms, channeling the power of dangerous impulses like anger and fear alongside hatred, jealousy, and despair, though some draw from the wells of dedication and zeal to wield their psychic powers! You'll find spiritualist humans, gnomes, half-orcs, and elves, but also stranger races like duergar, oreads, vanaras, and undines, running the gamut from good to evil and all points in between. With the Occult Character Codex, you'll have an entire arsenal of spiritualist characters waiting and ready to blow your players' minds!

189229.name: Vagabond-Class Frigate
189229.description:
From publisher blurb:

Frigates scout for the fleet, go on raiding missions, carry out patrols, convey messages and transport dignitaries. They also check out that suspicious-looking small freighter that a group of player characters is likely to be travelling in.

Or players might join the crew of a frigate as it adventures on a long mission through space. For a spacer, a frigate is a desirable posting. Frigates often see action, which means a greater chance of glory, promotion, and prize money.

Frigates are a good choice for role-playing compared to larger spaceships, which are reserved for fleet actions. There are also advantages compared to smaller vessels, which do not have the ability to travel such long distances on patrol.

The Vagabond is a "home base" for players in the navy, a familiar and comfortable refuge from the bizarre and unusual things they see during their adventures, or a scourge for players who are trying to go about less legal business.

So, whether you are trying to clear the spacelanes of pirates, or whether you are a pirate sitting in a cell in the belly, the Vagabond-class frigate is a good addition to any game.

189230.name: Beast-Class Destroyer
189230.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Beast-class destroyer is a versatile military design. It is designed to screen bigger spaceships from fighters, but also to take on much larger enemy spaceships if required.

The Beast-class destroyer is the sort of spaceship that might be sent to capture a group of sci-fi travellers, or other space adventurers who have broken the rules.

189231.name: Holiday Heroes & Horrors 2: Holiday Horrorers
189231.description:
From publisher blurb:

Just when you though it was safe to go back in the barren arctic tundra...

Return to White Hell in Holiday Heroes & Horrors 2: Holiday Horrorers! Featuring 10 all-new cold and survival-based spells and 6 all-new arctic monsters, including:

Ferocious Pine: A very mean tree
Blubber Golem: A pyromantic beast made of whale flesh.
Weribou: The fierce and ferocious were-caribou.
Snow Angel: A superplanar being of pure light.
Wooden Soldier: Stalwart soldiers made of wood.
Frost Zombie: Chilling undead minions of the Winter Lich.

189232.name: Raider's Haul: Vikmordere Magic Item Compendium
rpgseries: Into the Wintery Gale: A Vikmordere Saga
189232.description:
From publisher blurb:

Life in the Vikmordere Valley is harsh, especially during the wintery white, yet humans have survived in this brutally frigid environment for centuries. Their trials have birthed a vibrant culture bursting with an array of tools and magic items entirely unique to the region. Amidst these pages you will find a selection of treasures ranging from affordable arcana to priceless artifacts useful in any campaign.

This beautifully illustrated Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible book includes:

Relevant Vikmordere cultural information
29 Nordic-themed wondrous items
8 magic armaments
5 magic weapon
2 new weapon special abilities

189233.name: Ninja Rivals
189233.description:
In the card game Ninja Rivals, you are ninja masters of rival clans battling to finish missions and attain victory. Collect gold by completing objectives, play tricks on your opponents, surprise them with smoke bombs. Keep an eye on the resources in your hand otherwise, you might find the next mission is out of your reach.

At the start of the game, a mission is revealed and aloud for all to hear, including objectives and any secondary objectives if available. Then each player draws 2 cards from the NINJA DECK in order. Now the mission phase begins.

Starting with the first player, each player must choose to place a card from their hand face down into play directly in front of them or pass and draw a card from the NINJA DECK.

After a player has performed one of these two actions their turn is over, if they have over 10 cards in their hand they must discard down to 10 cards. They may also immediately play surprise cards to get their hand size down.

Play continues around the table until either, one player has 5 cards in front of them when the FIRST PLAYER is about to START their NEXT turn or All players have passed in succession.

Players reveal their cards and compare scores against the mission requirements, the winner claims the mission and the gold for their clan.

189234.name: Orion: A Sci-Fi Visual Novel
189234.description:
Orion is a science-fiction visual novel centered on the implications of time travel, artificial intelligence, and humanity’s ascent to the stars. After discovering a secret plan to destroy his home, Sam Acacius must decide whether he’s willing to tempt fate… and change the future.

Source: The Developer Website.

189235.name: Beach Bounce
189235.description:
User Summary

A visual novel in three parts following a boy visiting a beach resort and the romantic entanglement that ensue.

189236.name: Loot! Need or Greed
189236.description:
MMORPGs, or Massively Multiplayer Online Role Playing Games, all focus on the process of acquiring loot. Sure, some of them are set in outer space where you fight galactic wars over high-tech loot, and some are set in fantasy worlds where you slay massive beasts for magical loot, but all in all the objective is the same: People just can’t seem to get enough loot. That’s where this game, Loot! Need or Greed, comes in. We are streamlining the process for you, bypassing all that needless adventuring and skipping straight to the item drops. Just like in online-play, there is a certain etiquette that needs to be followed when competing for loot with your peers, and that’s where the strategy comes in. And above all, always remember – No one likes a Loot Ninja!

Loot! Need or Greed is a dice & card game for 2-6 players. Each round, players will attempt to out-roll each other on valuable loot items that their character could use while attempting to figure out what classes the other players are equipping for. They may even be so bold as to roll on items they can’t use, but if they are caught “Needing” on items their class can’t use they could be kicked from the party – and the game!

189237.name: Shutter
189237.description:
User Summary

A short adventure game that has you controlling a small robot with the job of taking photographs in a haunted house. Camera angles and the character that sends you your objective are callbacks to older horror games.

189238.name: Fullblast
189238.description:
User summary

Fullblast is a typical 80s arcade shoot'em-up. The player controls a craft and should shoot down the enemy ships entering the screen all the while avoiding enemy fire and ships.

Certain enemies drop power ups that can enhance the player's fire power.

189239.name: Home Improvisation
videogamehonor: 2016 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Multiplayer) Nominee
189239.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Home Improvisation is a furniture assembly experience.

189240.name: Q
189240.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1530; Stage One: Samuel Briggson; Stage Two: Josh Crowe; Stage Three: Michael Wenman
Stage One Title: A Bard's Tale
Stage Two Title: Quiet Night




From the Introduction:

“Gather round and let us tell the stories of the heroes of the previous
world. Your parents, your uncles and in some cases, your older siblings.
They fought and died so that we might live.”
“Let us set the stage: Monsters poured from the darkness, literally killing
sound as they went. We tried to sound the alarm, the bell moved but no
sound came. Our shouts made us hoarse, but little else. The monsters came
and destroyed the world that was. But we were not defeated yet. People
banded together and learned to fight the monsters. And they may yet succeed
in destroying all the monsters.”
In “Quiet Night” you play as the children of heroes. Listening and pitching
in to the tale woven by the village bard. The Bard leads a series of tales,
while the audience contribute by describing the actions of survivors who
were related to them.

189241.name: The Malady of Elventree
189241.description:
From the introduction:

An escaped duergar slave stumbles into the village of Elventree. With her she brings a malady that grips the small settlement in a bout of madness that seems unshakable. Can you find the source of the madness and save yourself and the village’s inhabitants?

A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

189242.name: The Waydown
189242.description:
From the introduction:

The recent discovery of an entrance to the Underdark has set local leaders on edge. In a display of initiative, the First Lord of Hillsfar has ordered the construction of defensive structures surrounding what locals have begun to call "The Waydown." You have been charged with escorting an emissary back to his home in the Underdark without alerting the Red Plumes.

A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

189243.name: House of Hades
189243.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1532; Stage One: David Rothfelder; Stage Two: Joe Jeskiewicz; Stage Three: Aaron Kesher
Stage One and Two Title: Waiting Room




From the Introduction:

It was, perhaps, inevitable: The world was murdered. And we now live in the ruins of that
murder, its shadows affecting our every action and interaction. We continue to live, though our
world is a grave. Sometimes, though, someone has a vision of something different, a clue to the
unasked question, "How was it the world was killed?" This vision opens a door into the House
of Fear, the House of Dust---the House of Hades.
And once you've been a guest in that House, well, things will never be the same again...

189244.name: The Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide and You!
189244.description:
From the introduction:

At long last we have the Sword Coast Adventurer’s Guide in our hot little hands and, we must say, it is a great book. Along with some great background information on the Sword Coast, we’ve also got some compelling character options for our budding heroes. The questions on everyone’s lips are:

A. What can I use when I create a new character for D&D Adventurers League?

B. Can I rebuild an existing D&D Adventurers League character with these options?

User summary:

The initial version was published November 3, 2015. A revised edition (with added text in distinguishing red) was published November 6, 2015.

189245.name: Silver Tongues
189245.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1533; Stage One: Abram Bussiere; Stage Two: Richie Janukowicz; Stage Three: Ant Wu




From the Introduction:

This is a story-telling game of charm, greed and friendly rivalry for 3 or more players.

The aim of the game is amass more Tokens than other players by using descriptive story elements to narrate how your character overcomes conflicts and obstacles on their road to financial glory, while attempting to cause as many issues for the other players by laying problems in their path.

Thematically interaction between characters should be modelled on the portrayals of Captain Jack Sparrow, Captain Barbossa et al from the Pirates of the Caribbean film franchise, though any setting is possible and indeed appropriate.

189247.name: Forgeborn
189247.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1534; Stage One: Adam Blinkinsop; Stage Two: Bill White; Stage Three: Russell Borogove
Stage One Title: Quest of the Forgeborn




From the Introduction:
The Sword of the Red Phoenix. The Flamewright Hammer. The Nightfall Cloak. The Boots of
Nythrial. These powerful Artifacts were all cra!ed by the Master Smiths of the Forge, and now a!er
many trials, much training, and years of apprenticeship you’ve joined their number. You can only hope
that you will be worthy to place your works among the treasures of the Citadel, to be held in its wellguarded
vault until a Heroine shall come and prove their need to the Masters.
Overview
This is a game for 2-4 players plus a GM. Each of the players represents a Master Smith of the Citadel
of the Forge, responsible for cra!ing wondrous objects and endowing them upon the supplicant Heroines
who require them to fulfill their quests and fight the evils that plague the kingdom.

189248.name: GURPS Aliens: Sparrials
189248.description:
Publisher's description

From The Trees To The Stars

With their small size, deft hands, and keen senses, the sparrials are made to order for the GM in need of a race of alien thieves. And certainly, they have a predisposition toward that role. Yet as always with sparrials, there's a lot more going on than meets the eye . . .

A GURPS fixture since they popped up in Roleplayer #10 (May 1988), these furry aliens got a bit more detail in GURPS Classic: Aliens -- and now GURPS Aliens: Sparrials is here to give them their own dedicated supplement. The inaugural volume of the GURPS Aliens series covers sparrials in all their clever, chaotic glory. It includes a full racial template, of course, and much, much more:

Mindset. For sparrials, theft is a source of pride rather than shame, home is where you are and not where you're from, and the smell is the thing. Treat them like short, furry humans at your peril!
Society. How do you define "civilization" for a race strongly characterized by wanderlust, kleptomania, and individualism? With care! Learn everything you need to know about their ideas of family, social dominance, law, economics, and the arts before you visit.
History. The lack of huge empires and widespread cooperation doesn't mean sparrials were uncultured primitives until their recent technological revolution. They have a past rich in folklore and legend, and would be happy to tell you all about it.
Tech. Though new arrivals on the interstellar scene, the sparrials have embraced technology and developed everything from personal gear to starships that reflect their outlook on life.
Characters. Take advantage of extensive notes on common traits, variant races, racial martial arts, and fitting professions to create interesting and detailed sparrial PCs and NPCs.
And more! Names. Pets. Using sparrials in fantasy. If it's about sparrials, it's here!

GURPS Aliens: Sparrials is a wonderful resource whether you're a GM seeking aliens to populate your GURPS Space campaign or a player who wants the challenge of taking the role of a truly alien alien. It's also an inspiring source of fun for gamers using other game systems. Just remember to keep an eye on your stuff.

189249.name: Star Wars: Galactic Defense
189249.description:
Skills are put to the test as you choose your allegiance – light or dark – and deploy an arsenal of specialized towers and iconic Star Wars™ characters to defend key locations in the new tower defense mobile game, Star Wars™: Galactic Defense.

Battles sprawl diverse locations from the Star Wars universe. Traverse more than 100 different battle scenarios, and experience a mix of adrenaline-fueled encounters that span both the prequel and classic eras. Command up to three Star Wars champions like Luke Skywalker, Obi-Wan Kenobi, and Yoda at once, each featuring unique strengths and powerful abilities. The placement and execution of these defenses are do-or-die decisions.

Source: The Game Website.

189250.name: Reset Generation
videogamehonor: 2009 D.I.C.E. Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
189250.description:
Reset Generation includes ten archetypal characters easily recognizable by older players who grew up with the NES and Mega Drive/Genesis, with some of the more easily recognizable characters being a hedgehog, plumber, monster trainer and a level 50 elf. Apart from having 4-player matches, the game also offers an 18 mission-based single-player campaign.

Source: Wikipedia, "Reset Generation", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189252.name: Pirates of the Burning Sea
videogamehonor: 2009 D.I.C.E. Massively Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
189252.description:
Pirates of the Burning Sea is a game is set in the Caribbean in an anachronistic 1720 and combines tactical ship battles and swashbuckling combat with a player-driven economy and open-ended gameplay. In the game, players can choose from 4 nations, Great Britain, Spain, France and the Pirates.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pirates of the Burning Sea", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189253.name: Flashback and Fate
189253.description:
#Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Entry



This RPG item was a submission to the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge. It was developed by three different designers in a randomized, anonymous fashion. For details, and for information on how the versions are structured, see the series RPGGeek entry here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge 2015. All of the entries are available here: #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge Winners and Everything
Entry #1535; Stage One: Eric Nieudan; Stage Two: Mark Nau; Stage Three: Jaye Foster
Stage One Title: Too Many Flashbacks
Stage Two Title: Flashback

189254.name: Temple of the Lost Gods PDQ Conversion
189254.description:
From the introduction:

This document is a free guide for converting the characters, creatures, and challenges of Steve Jackson Games' Temple of the Lost Gods from GURPS Lite (3rd Edition) to Atomic Sock Monkey Press' Prose Descriptive Qualities (PDQ) System, as well as providing a PDQ adaptation of the magic systems within that product.

Therefore, to take full advantage of this guide, one must possess:


A copy of Temple of the Lost Gods; and
A copy of the PDQ System Core Rules

189255.name: Magnomania
189255.description:
From the front of the manual:
It's amazing what you can accomplish if you don't mind who gets the credit.

From the back of the manual:
Magnomania (some higlights):

You are an entrepreneur for Magnus
Establish your consultants in as many countries as possible
Try to get 'In Business' with your projects
Plan your strategy and make smart choices
Collect the points you need to win Magnomania




From the first page of the rules:
In this game you'll take part in Magnus' worldwide expansion.
Are you the sharpest entrepreneur? Will you be the first one to achieve your goal?
Consider your investment decisions carefully, execute takeovers, and make sure you get the biggest share of the market.
Play Magnomania, plan, decide, and win!

The game in brief:
As a player of Magnomania, you are a Magnus entrepreneur. You travel as an entrepreneur around the gameboard and try to be the first to earn the required number of points in order win. You earn points by taking the biggest market share on a given continent and being 'In Business' internationally. As soon as an entrepreneur (pawn) arrives in a country he can begin a consultancy project. You indicate the stages of your project by a consultant (disc). When a project is completed, you as the entrepreneur are 'In Business' in that country.

Magnomania was developed and produced on the authority of Magnus Management Consultancy (since 2009 call Eurogroup Consulting) by Identity Games International B.V., Rotterdam, the Netherlands.

189257.name: 2d6 Quick & Dirty
189257.description:
User summary:

2d6 Quick & Dirty is a rules-light generic, universal RPG system. Character creation consists of the player generating a list of Traits (narrative tags) and allocating points to those traits, from a point pool.

Whenever an action is attempted "that might fail", the player rolls 2d6 and adds any modifier from an appropriate Trait; the Game Master may enforce other modifiers (penalties or bonuses). A result of 8 or better succeeds. A natural roll of 2 always fails and a natural roll of 12 always succeeds, regardless of modifiers.

Combat works in the same way, except the opponents each generate a roll and result with the winner determining the loser's fate. This may involve damage to a trait which may recover at the Game Master's discretion.

189258.name: SamenSpel
189258.description:
The Dutch word samenspel has the meaning of: working together towards a common goal. A bit odd, considering that samen means together, but spel means game, not work.

The game was published in 1987 and given to employees of the AZU (Het Academisch Ziekenhuis Utrecht or the Academic Hospital in Utrecht, the Netherlands) as a Christmas / New Years gift.

In 1989 the AZU, part of the Universiteit van Utrecht (University of Utrecht) moved to a new building. The construction of that building started in 1981 and in 1986 the first preparation were made towards the movement, which required all patients to be moved in only two days.

This game was published in 1987 and given as a Christmas / New Years gift to the employees. The name of the game (SamenSpel, working together) is a reference to the effort of the individual employees to make the moving a success.

SamenSpel is a game about collecting pieces of illustrations related to the hospital and the moving to a new building. This is done by moving a pawn on a board one step in any one direction (somewhat like a rook in chess) and taking the piece (one quarter of the full image) from the board.

The game has one pawn, one gameboard and 12 complete images (each to be divided into four segments) but no dice. The pieces are shuffled and randomly distributed over the board, putting two pieces on each area of the board, the board has 25 spaces (the center space has no image). Whoever collects the compete images first, wins the game. When moving the pawn back to the center space, a player can "claim" a segment of an image of another player, provided he/she already owns at least one segment himself/herself.

189260.name: Arcane Saga
189260.description:
User summary:

Characters have seven Attributes (Strength, Endurance, Agility, Perception, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma) with Scores ranging from 2-12. Scores are randomly generated or assigned from a standard array. Characters next select a race (Human, Elf, Dwarf, or Orc) and Skills. Characters start with 8 Skill points and gain new points with each experience level. Some Skills are character specialties that grant certain Abilities (roughly analogous to Feats).

Action resolution involves a modified D10 roll compared to a target number or defense. The remainder of the rules list weapons, armor, items, and magic items, explain alchemy, and have suggestions to the Campaign Manager including resources and a bestiary.

189261.name: Arcadia Quest: Nina
189261.description: Nina is a playable hero with a miniature and card for Arcadia Quest and Arcadia Quest Inferno. She is a kick-starter exclusive character gotten by having backed Arcadia Quest: Inferno, and additionally having made the optional purchase for the Arcadia Quest: Chaos Dragon expansion.

189262.name: Arcadia Quest: Pets – Cerby
189262.description: Cerby is a playable pet with a miniature and card for Arcadia Quest and Arcadia Quest Inferno, when using the Pets expansion. This is a kick-starter exclusive pet gotten by having backed Arcadia Quest: Inferno, and additionally having made the optional purchase for the Arcadia Quest: Pets expansion.

189263.name: Last Word
189263.description:
Photographer Whitty Gawship attends a prestigious get-together at the residence of the impressive Professor Chet Chatters. Members of the party are veteran conversationalists, each trying to gain subtle power over one-another. The mood shifts when Whitty and the others discover that the professor can get the last word in every conversation via his miraculous invention. Dastardly!

But what are the professor's motives? And why invite a commoner?
Last Word is an unconventional JRPG-like. Battle sophisticated guests using words as weapons. Collect topics by gossiping to unlock mysteries. Drink wine. The night is young and no one can leave until the devious Professor Chatters says so! Can Whitty and Seymour overcome the power of the professor's amazing machine? Or will they succumb to the saucy banter of the motley aristocrats around them? Don't hesitate in getting the Last Word.

Source: The Developer Website.

189264.name: Universal Adventures Adventure Module BH2: Caverns of the Blood Howlers
189264.description:
From publisher blurb:

The quest that began in Black Willow Gorge continues in Caverns of the Blood Howlers!

The clearing is quiet and still. The last sounds of the battle fade into the dismal depths of the gorge and the past day’s events return with shocking clarity. The struggle through the strange, hazardous land and the battles with its bizarre, deadly inhabitants brought you here, to this clearing, yet the object of your quest is not here. Her fate and yours now lay beyond the huge doors of ancient, verdigris bronze.

Universal Adventures Caverns of the Blood Howlers is the second part in the two-part Blood Howlers adventure. The adventure takes the characters beyond the great bronze doors where there is yet hope of completing their quest, if they are brave enough, tough enough, to make their way past the deadly inhabitants, dangerous traps and strange encounters that await within. Succeed, and they can return as heroes. Fail, and the characters may not return at all.

The Adventure Module includes a new Adventure Record, 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards and 18 Treasure cards. In addition, to capture the old school dungeon feel we’ve included several areas that are detailed in Custom Encounters and Custom Encounters II. If you want to add more variety, strange events and encounters, you can expand on these adventure areas with cards from Custom Encounters and Custom Encounters II.

Caverns of the Blood Howlers takes the characters on an old school, dark and deadly dungeon delve, full of dangerous foes, strange sites and fabulous treasure. Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing game, Caverns of the Blood Howlers can be played solo or with a group, with or without a GM. The adventure is highly re-playable and compatible with other Universal Adventures cards. In addition, you can combine the cards with other cards from the series, or cards from other Universal Adventures products, to create your own adventures.

The Adventure Module is a new, simple way to play fantasy adventures. The organization and presentation of the adventures allows for quick setup, quick play and gives you the ability to focus on the action and “story” while leaving you the option to include tactical action and combat if you desire. Enter a new and exciting world of adventure, full of wonder and surprises. Enter the Caverns of the Blood Howlers!

189265.name: RobotiCS strategic card game
189265.description:
You've come to the arena stunning with its dominance over the city. There is no building, which would overshadow it. From the battlefield to the ceiling it is crowded with spectators dressed in the color of the programmer clans. The inner ring is simple. Floor filled with sand, the only apparent thing is the ellipse, which always turns on the power shield protecting the spectators. There are usually fighting two teams in such battlefield, at least one robot at each side led by a programmer. Will you become one of those famous programmers who shout commands to their robots and fight for the title? Build your deck so you can use your strategy toward winning in tournaments of RobotiCS.

RobotiCS strategic deck-building card game offers to every player an opportunity to become a Programmer of majestic robots which are fighting with each other in a battle duels. Every player starts with the same starting deck and develops it and its strategy during the game (= deck-building system).

RobotiCS card game is about strategic combat of α-Robots supported by their Programmers. α-Robots are loosing their hit and shield points, whilst Programmers are receiving exhaustion counters. During the game players are combining their powerful abilities. But α-Robots can carry only one piece of each equipment, therefore players need to purchase β-Robots. The game can be influenced by Action and Reaction Program cards with immediate effects. There are being arisen many strategies during the games such as discard, healing, multiplication of β-Robots, agro, etc. 203 cards guarantee always countless different combinations.

RobotiCS card game is optimized for 2 players. But families or friends could play it also in a group of 3 or 4 players. Easy understandable structure of game play is based on building the strategy of the deck during the game. It enables the player to react to the tactical actions of his/her opponent. It is not needed to purchase additional booster packs to construct decks before play (strongest advantage in comparison to trading card games). All strategic potential of the game is in one box. The game offers many different tactical situations to solve, free-time fun with friends and possibility to meet people during organized play events.

189266.name: Das Bodensee-Spiel
189266.description:
The players have to travel from Lindau around the Bodensee to Bregenz, where they continue the trip by boat. Movement is determined bay a die. The first player to reach one of the 6 golden harbors with the exact roll of the die wins the game.
The game was published in the 1930s or 1940s.

189267.description:
Europe is up in arms, the revolution is everywhere. The people rebels against their monarchies to have a Constitution.

Do you think it will happen also in our country? I do not see why, majesty. You are a great king and Belgium already has a Constitution. But there's always someone unhappy and Belgium is no exception; riots will happen here as well and we will have to intervene. You will not want to use weapons against your people, majesty! Yes of course, my weapons will be firmness and justice.

In February 1848, Leopold I helped to maintain peace remaining neutral during the revolutionary events that upset Europe between January of 1848 and spring of 1849. He also played an important role in stopping the spread of the Revolution into Belgium. These riots were a series of political upheavals throughout Europe, that remains the most widespread revolutionary wave in European history, but within a year, reactionary forces had regained control and the revolutions collapsed.

With the Riots expansion, players have to manage riots in the provinces of Belgium and use them for their purpose ruining the plans of the opponents. They can also use the King Leopold I not only to get victory points by majorities and factories, but also turning off the hotbed of revolution in the country.

Contents: 10 riot tokens, mini-rulebook.

This exclusive expansion was supplied to Kickstarter Deluxe participants.

Note: The description is taken from the Kickstarter stretch goal text, the contents here have been corrected from the originally stated 8 to the final number of 10 riot markers.
189267.name: The Foreign King: Riots Expansion

189268.name: The Isle
189268.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




The first game mode being developed is an open-world survival experience where players will choose to play as one of three human factions; Rangers, Mercenaries or Poachers. They will face off against the primeval inhabitants of The Isle with superior fire power and technology, relying on their wits to survive the hostile environment and their force of will to endure.

Source: The Game Website.

189270.name: Operación: Zombies Perú
189270.description:
In Operación: Zombies Perú, each player plays the role of a Chief of Operations who must deal with what he has to rescue as many Civil Groups crammed and hidden throughout the city. Players must work as fast as they can because once all the needed helicopters arrive, the city will be abandoned and only the civil groups on the Rescue Zone will be saved. You can hinder your opponents' rescue missions by sending zombies to slow their work.

On each turn you draw a card and you play a card, taking into account that you can't have less the one card on your hand at the end of your turn. You play cards against your opponents or to help yourself keep safe your Civil Groups.

Operación: Zombies Perú finishes when a certain amount of helicopters are placed in different Rescue Zones.

This game is filled with laughter as you try to remain untouched and hinder your opponents at the same time.

189271.name: FreeOrion
189271.description:
FreeOrion is a free, open source, turn-based space empire and galactic conquest (4X) computer game being designed and built by the FreeOrion project. FreeOrion is inspired by the tradition of the Master of Orion games, but is not a clone or remake of that series or any other game.

Source: [FreeOrion Wiki].

189272.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 5.

This small expansion contains 48 quarter-circle tokens representing Quarter Bean Dollars (QBDs).

When playing with Bean Market, there is a market that players may purchase from on their turn with QBDs. At any time on your turn, you can buy exactly one card from the bean market to plant immediately.

You can combine Bean Market with Bohnanza – The Expansion, La Isla Bohnitâ, Ladybohn, Bohnaparte, and Bohnröschen, as well as the base game.
189272.name: Bohnanza: Bean Market

189273.description:
From the publisher:

Whole Lotta Lava includes a couple of brand new scenarios designed to plug into the Inferno campaign, utilizing Ignos, the Hellcats and the Fallen Angel! Through the course of an Inferno campaign, you'll simply be able to pick these scenarios instead of those from the Inferno campaign, and they will present you with all new challenges and opportunities, featuring new Quest cards, as well as new Reward Upgrades that you'll be able to bring into your campaign!
189273.name: Arcadia Quest: Inferno – Whole Lotta Lava

189275.name: Tinker Tactics
189275.description: Tinker Tactics is an abstract microgame for 2 or 4 players and takes around 5-10 minutes to play. Players move their d4, d6, and d8 dice on a 4x6 grid, attempting to capture the opponents dice. The winner is the last man standing.

189276.name: The Jackbox Party Pack
189276.description:
For 1-100 players!
Your phones or tablets are your controllers!
The team behind YOU DON’T KNOW JACK presents FIVE guffaw-inducing party games in one pack!
Games include:
The comedy trivia sensation YOU DON’T KNOW JACK 2015 (1-4 players) with hundreds of all-new questions.
The hilarious bluffing game Fibbage XL (2-8 players), with 50% more questions added to the original hit game Fibbage.
The bizarre drawing game Drawful (3-8 players), where you draw right there on your phone or tablet.
The racy-as-you-want-to-be fill-in-the-blank word game Word Spud (2-8 players).
The wacky-fact-filled Lie Swatter (1-100 players).
Players play using their phones, tablets, or even computers as controllers – making it the perfect easy-in entertainment piece for your next game night or party. Once a game is started from the in-pack menu, players simply connect to the “jackbox.tv” web address on their device and then enter the provided 4-letter room code to enter a game. No big mess of controllers needed!

Source: The Publisher Website.

189277.name: The Jackbox Party Pack 2
189277.description:
It’s the sequel to the party game phenomenon The Jackbox Party Pack, featuring FIVE fresh, rib-tickling party games! Games include:

Fibbage 2 (2-8 players)
The runaway hit bluffing game with over 500 brand-new questions, more than 2x the original! Plus new features, like the deFIBrillator!
Earwax (3-8 players)

The hear-larious sound-effects game that will leave you up to your ears in laughter! Cow moo? Huge explosion? Or tiny fart? Which to choose?
Bidiots (3-6 players)

The absurd art auction game where you draw right there on your phone or tablet. Outbid your opponents for weird art pieces – drawn by players themselves – and win this strangely competitive auction game! Don’t be a bidiot!
Quiplash XL (3-8 players)

The say-anything, gut-busting Quiplash XL (3-8 players), which includes everything in Quiplash, Quip Pack 1, AND over 100 brand-new prompts!
Bomb Corp. (1-4 players)

The bomb-defusing nailbiter of a party game! As interns at Bomb Corp., you must defuse random bombs in the office in order to keep your jobs. You’ll probably die, but it’ll be good work experience!

Players play using their phones, tablets, or even computers as controllers – making it the perfect easy-to-join party starter. No extra controllers needed! And, up to 10,000 spectators can join and affect some games by playing as Audience members!

Source: The Publisher Website.

189278.name: Don't Starve: Shipwrecked
189278.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Sail to adventure through the treacherous seas of Don't Starve: Shipwrecked!

Klei Entertainment has partnered with our friends at Capy, creators of Superbrothers: Sword and Sworcery, Super Time Force and Below; to bring fans of Don’t Starve the latest single-player expansion: Don’t Starve: Shipwrecked!

With new playable characters, biomes, creatures and seasonal effects; Wilson and the whole Don’t Starve cast of characters embark on a sea-bound journey of exploration, adaptation and of course, starvation.

Source: The Publisher Website.

189279.name: The Tavern of Daednu
189279.description:
From the PDF introduction:

The Tavern of Daednu is a short adventure for 3-8 characters of 1st-3rd level. The scenario works best with characters of low level who are veteran players. They will of course be suspicious and fully knowledgeable of the monsters that they will encounter, making the unpredictability and horror of the tavern that much more of a surprise. That said, although it may
confuse novice players a bit, it will also work for them as well.

From the Cover:

As you trudge along wearily, contemplating another night beneath the stars, you round a bend in the road, and something strange catches your eye. The last rays of the setting sun, and the pale light of evening illuminate an edifice standing along the side of the road, no more than a quarter of a mile away. It is a large two-story building, with a stable and a well to one side. It is far too large to be a house, and in fact, it almost looks like an inn!

As you approach the building, you see it is a decently constructed, two-story, stone and wood edifice. A lamp hangs from a spar protruding from the wall, illuminating a green sign with red trim. In flowing, golden script the sign proclaims that this place is the “Tavern of Daednu.”

189280.name: The Barrow of the Moon Druid
189280.description:
From the PDF introduction:

The Barrow of the Moon Druid should, at first, appear to be a traditional 5-room dungeon adventure. If the player characters are successful in surviving the barrow, on the next full moon, it will become clear to the players that the barrow was indeed no mere 5-room dungeon, but rather an ominous curse.

From the Cover:

As your party travels the Old Road which cuts a path through the dangerous moorlands, you spy an old barrow sitting off in the distance. An old gnarled tree, the only tree to be seen on the moor, sits atop the barrow watching over the round door set back deep in the mound. What possible treasures lie within the barrow mound, the one said to be the burial location of the Moon Druid? Who within the party will be brave enough to enter The Barrow of the Moon Druid?

189281.name: The Legend of the White Snake
189281.description:
From the PDF introduction:

The Legend of the White Snake is an elaborate story derived from an ancient Chinese legend that originated in Hangzhou, China, which was told perhaps as early as the Tang Dynasty (circa 600 A.D.). The story continued to develop through oral tradition and was eventually recorded during the Ming Dynasty (circa 1300 A.D.). Although the story has developed and changed over time, the central story has not. It features a green turtle and a white snake who become human and the turtle-man falls in love with the beautiful white snake-woman. The woman, however, is offered an umbrella by a human and she falls in love with him and they soon marry. The turtle man, seeking revenge for his unrequited love, becomes a great cleric so he can turn the woman back into a white snake before her husband’s very eyes. The man and the turtle fight a great battle, and although the man wins, the evil cleric casts a spell that separates the couple forever.

From the Cover:

Originating in Hangzhou, China, this ancient legend tells of a turtle and white snake who become human immortals. The turtle-man falls in love with the white snake-woman, but she rebukes him for a human whom she marries. The turtle, in anger, seeks his revenge by becoming a great cleric, turning the woman back to a white snake before her husband’s very eyes and separating the two forever. Can the adventuring party survive the island of the mist dragons and reunite the white snake with her husband Xu Xian? Find out in this famous Chinese legend – The Legend of the White Snake – now, for the first time, a First Edition Advanced Dungeons & Dragons adventure!

189282.name: Shootout
189282.description:
A fun and simple Western themed dice tabletop game, meant for 2 players ages 8 and up, that can be played anytime and anywhere.

Each player starts out with one bullet (red or blue dice) in their chamber. Each dice has a barrel, bullet, BANG. Each roll scores. For instance if Red rolls a barrel and blue rolls a bullet, blue scores as red is "hiding" in the barrel. If both roll bullets, each get a point. Each six rolls equals one round. Winner is the player who wins the most rounds. If both roll BANG, both miss each other and no one scores.

Quick, easy, filler game.

189283.name: Stele of the Silver Thane
189283.description:
From the publisher's web site:

An ambitious sorcerer schemes to hold sway over a fragmented eastern marchlands. An adventure for 1st or 2nd level characters.

189284.name: Cold Drake Canyon
189284.description:
From the publisher's website:

Decades ago Cold Drake Canyon was renowned for the silver mined by the dwarves. Now the silver trade has shrunk to a trickle, but rumours still abound of the hidden wealth to be found there. A mini-setting for character levels 1-8.

189285.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 2.12 - Dec 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Misfit Studios' New Releases -- Game Products
What's Going On with Misfit Studios
189285.description:
From publisher blurb:

The monthly newsletters by Misfit Studios presents news regarding what is going on with the company, recaps the products it released during the previous month, and offers a product promotion.

189286.name: Ynisare, the Lost Colony
189286.description:
User summary:

Ynisare is the second adventure in a series set in the world of Jahannam. It was released in support of the 3rd Edition of Ysgarth.

189287.name: Uchelglan, the Blood Tribute
189287.description:
User summary:

Blood Tribute is the first adventure in a series set in the world of Jahannam. It was released in support of the 3rd Edition of Ysgarth.

This booklet includes 12-page module and 4-page pull-out map section. It was printed at least twice.

189288.name: The New Ysgarth Rules (3rd Edition)
189288.description:
User summary:

The New Ysgarth Rules, 3rd Edition, was published in 1981 as a single 90-page booklet with a green cover showing a partial map of Ysgarth. This volume includes both game mechanics and some basic world background. It was supported by the publication of a series of adventures set in the world of Jahannam.

189289.name: Time Machine VR
189289.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

A plague is consuming humankind. As a time-travelling scientist, you must go back to the Jurassic and face dinosaurs whose DNA holds the key to our survival.

189290.name: Carnivores: Dinosaur Hunter Reborn
videogamedeveloper: Digital Dreams Entertainment LLC (Video Game Company)
videogamepublisher: Digital Dreams Entertainment LLC (Video Game Company)
189290.description:
User Summary

Carnivores: Dinosaur Hunter Reborn is a sequel to the original dinosaur hunting video game, Carnivores: Dinosaur Hunter.

189292.name: Quest: Lite
189292.description:
Designer's Description:

Quest is a structured freeform storytelling game where the players collaboratively build a fantasy world on the fly, filled with whatever things you find interesting in an ever more interconnected web of relationships. The stories are generally fast paced tales of adventure as the various characters you create all strive to complete quests, their paths crossing and parting, sometimes amicably, other times not so much.

'Quest Lite' is a cut down version suitable for single sessions, such as con games.

189293.name: Honour by Day... (Refined Version)
189293.description:
Designer's Description:

Honour by Day was written for Game Chef 2009 and since then has seen further playtesting and refinement.

It is a competitive GMless RPG that shares a lot in common with board games. You each play medieval knights competing in various scenarios for a series of rewards. The game is as focused on plots and schemes as it is on honour and chivalry.

The two scenarios are as follows:

The Tournament of St George: A jousting match, fighting for the hand of a fair princess. This is the original scenario an the most complete.
The Battle of Sterling Bridge: You are all generals fighting a war against he barbarians from the north, vying for power within your own ranks. The scenario is complete, but has some balance issues.

189294.description:
Yeti is a quick family dice game with extraordinary components and funny illustrations.

In Yeti players are competing adventurers and mountaineers, looking for traces of the Yeti, the legendary Snowman in the Himalaya. They want to find its footprints — or even better take photos of it — in order to collect points. To achieve this, they need to improve their equipment and acquire the help of Sherpas to lead them up the mountains. Most importantly, though, they should hope for good weather because if too much snow falls, the search of all players comes to a halt...
189294.name: Yeti

189295.name: Centerville, City Under Siege
189295.description:
From publisher blurb:

An American city taken hostage by a madman with an army of robotic soldiers and a cadre of bionically enhanced zealots! Kaiser Albrecht offers the world only two options; live on as his loyal subjects, or perish! Will Centerville be remembered as the first foot-fall in the Kaiser’s march to global domination, or the place where his evil ambitions were thwarted?

It’s up to you to decide the future of the world in this amazing new action-packed adventure only for the Villains and Vigilantes™ Superhero Role-Playing System.

189296.name: Admin's Toolkit: Character Class Creation Guide
189296.description:
From publisher blurb:

During development of White Lies, we tended to overthink things. Game balance... difficult and elusive. Especially in a world when a bullet can end a rookie agent in a single moment. In any given session, it may be your bluffing skills which win the day. Or your investigative prowess. So game balance becomes a bit of a complex subject.

In this PDF, which we're giving you for free (though feel free to encourage us with any donation you'd like), you can use the same system we used to create the character classes presented in White Lies. It also has a few behind-the-scenes tidbits you might find interesting if you're interested in developing a roleplaying game (OSR or otherwise).

189297.name: Lady Satan 1974
189297.description:
From publisher blurb:

"... and Lady Satan shall continue on at will!"

After being dormant for centuries, a spirit of ultimate evil stirs and seizes control of young Anne Jason's body. What follows is a violent struggle for control of a life that's been stolen... and to stop the will of Satan to be manifest on Earth.

Lady Satan 1974 is the first-ever collection of the entire blaxploitation-meets-the-occult series tthat first ran in Scream and Psycho magazines from Skywald Publishing. It is a little remarked upon milestone in American comics history, as it was the first series to star an African Amercian woman (even if she was possessed by a Bride of Satan for much of each of the four chapters).

In addition to the classic comics, Lady Satan 1974 contains OGL d20 System rules designed to bring the situation of two minds in one body to your d20 System campaings, as well as feats fitting for minions of Satan and other cultists, be they fighting on the side of good or evil

189298.name: Fedpost Mail Courier
189298.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gypsy Knights Games is proud to present the eleventh entry in our line of products dedicated to the starships of Clement Sector.

In 2334, Anderson and Felix were contracted by the newly formed Hub Federation Postal Service (Fedpost) to design and construct a fast mail courier with extended fuel capacity and as small a crew requirement as possible in order to deliver both electronic and physical mail.

Several design options were presented for consideration over the following twelve months until the managing board of Fedpost approved a small one hundred displacement tonne courier with enough internal fuel for two Zimm transits of two parsecs and multiple in-system skip-transits. The mail courier design included a maneuver drive capable of a thrust of two gravities.

The Fedpost Mail Courier is that design.

Ships of Clement Sector 11: Fedpost Mail Courier comes complete with beautiful views of the ship. The courier is presented with full deckplans and statistics to make your use of our product simple, easy and fun. In addition, the courier comes with a set of adventure hooks to get your characters right into the action as well as a short story written by Bradley Warnes.

In addition, Ships of Clement Sector 11: Fedpost Mail Courier also comes with a Fedpost career track to enable players to join this new and vibrant organization!

189299.name: Bulk Freighter
189299.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The space craft introduced in this installment of the series is a 2000 dT freighter.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

189300.name: The Partisan Cargo Version
189300.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 48 inch by 30 inch, floor plan of a Cargo Spaceship, with Hex, Square and No overlay.

The Zip File includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“Time to spring the trap for the pirates. Split the ship!” –

Captain of The Partisan.

The Partisan (Cargo Version) is a single floor interior map of a spaceship that can split in half to function as two separate vessels. Both sides of the vessel have crew and cargo compartments.

The Partisan (Cargo Version) is intended for use in near or far-future science fiction settings.

Tithe of the Tenth Cargo (Part Two): The Constabulary caught The Partisan red-handed trying to send innocent passengers into slavery. Rather than put them into jail, The Constabulary has decided to use them as bait to capture more Red Drudge pirates. During their next drop in a different cargo ship configuration, The Constabulary sends either a Constabulary patrol ship or a mercenary ship to take out the pirates at the next drop. The mercenaries are to be paid with The Partisan’s cargo, as they owe The Constabulary their continued freedom. Flying either ship, the group fights the pirates while trying to save both parts of The Partisan.

These pirates however bear a more traditional skull and crossbones symbol and go after both sections of The Partisan. They are clearly not the Red Drudge pirates allied with The Partisan at all.

The Constabulary finds this curious. What pirate group would only want human slaves and not cargo? The Constabulary investigates the matter further…

189301.name: The End of the World: Alien Invasion
189301.description:
Description from the publisher:

Earth has come under attack from extraterrestrial lifeforms! Countless adventures await in the five scenarios included in Alien Invasion, an otherworldly take on The End of the World roleplaying line, originally designed by Álvaro Loman and José M. Rey. This standalone roleplaying game features an elegant, narrative ruleset that keeps the focus on the story and offers you the chance to play as yourself in the midst of the apocalypse. The unique scenario structure of Alien Invasion offers compelling experiences over a single session or a far-reaching campaign. Make first contact and prepare for an alien invasion!

189302.name: Anointed: Mantle of the Gods
189302.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rise up!

Humanity struggles to live in a world consumed with violence and magic. Elder races and their gods plan and carry out wars on each other. Demons hunt fresh bodies to possess and people to control. Leviathans feed off of Terror to create havoc among men. Rival gods and hostile tribes seek their rivals’ end. It is up to the tribal heroes, Anointed Ones, to defend their tribe, mete out justice and lead people to a new age of enlightenment. As a champion for your god, you are granted powers to give you the edge. Curry favor with your god to ensure Fate is on your side as you vanquish your foes. In this book, you will find:

An introduction to the Known World in the short story, “The Old Sylph on the Mountain”
Everything you need to create a character, including character sheets and Anointed pre-generate character types
A unique rule system, called the Anointed System, with chapters dedicated to Tasks, Skills, Powers, Miniature *Movement and Combat
A trade and equipment chapter with trade routes and the continent of Naalgrom mapped
A solo adventure set in the land of Kathonia, Central Naalgrom, with maps of the area




This is Bronze Age fantasy at its finest.

Rise up, mankind, and become Anointed!

189303.description:
User summary:
冷戦ペンギン (Reisen Penguin) means Cold War Penguin in English.

Cold War Penguin is a battle game between East and West spy penguins during the Cold War era in the world of penguins. Steal the enemy's secret or shoot them dead. It's a short and sharp game, for 4 players only playing as two partnerships.

Publisher's summary:
ペンギン世界の冷戦時代に活躍した東西のスパイペンギン達の戦い。
お互いの情報を持ち帰り、時には射殺。短く鋭利なショートゲーム。
189303.name: Reisen Penguin

189304.name: Undertome
189304.description: Undertome is a horror themed strategy card game comprised of 100 unique cards which players draw from a single deck (The Tome). Each card has a different effect which players must carefully choose to play during their turn because once a spell has been cast, the page is burned in the ashes never to be used again (or is it?). Players have a limited amount of Courage which they must guard as once you lose it, you are filled with overwhelming dread taking you out of the game.

189305.name: Usagi no Ougon Jidai
189305.description:
User summary:
ウサギの黄金時代 (Usagi no Ougon Jidai) means Rabbits' Golden Age in English. The publisher gives it as PaxUSANA, a pun on Pax Romana.

PaxUSANA is a game of administration in the world of rabbits during their golden age. Effectively use your three actions to collect the resources, meet the demands, and aim to achieve 6 points. It can also be played solo.

Publisher's summary:
ウサギ世界の最盛期を舞台とした執政ゲーム。
３回のアクションを駆使し資源を集めて需要を回し6勝利点を目指す。
ソロプレイにも対応"

189306.name: Los Refuerzos de Extremadura
189306.description: Published in Alea magazine 23, adds a variant and new units for playing Los Arapiles Scenario IV.

189307.name: SpongeBob Squarepants: Legend of the Lost Spatula
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
189307.description:
As SpongeBob, the player embarks on an undersea quest to find the Flying Dutchman's Golden Spatula in order to become the ocean's greatest short-order cook. If SpongeBob gets hit, his clothing falls off. If SpongeBob is wearing a jacket power-up, he loses it when he is hit. If he takes a hit with no jacket, his pants fall off, leaving him to run around in his underwear. If his underwear falls off, he loses a life. Along the way, SpongeBob meets and interacts with many of the show's popular recurring characters like Mr. Krabs, Squidward Tentacles, Sandy Cheeks, and Patrick Star. The game uses elements of adventure and side-scrolling gameplay.

Source: Wikipedia, "SpongeBob SquarePants: Legend of the Lost Spatula", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189308.name: Warhammer 40,000: Conquest – Wrath of the Crusaders
189308.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the midst of a worldwide battle, the Black Templars arrive to recover the holy relics of St. Camila. Lead their mission in Wrath of the Crusaders, the fifth War Pack in the Planetfall cycle for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest!

Like the other War Packs of the Planetfall cycle, Wrath of the Crusaders encourages new play styles by adding greater significance to planet type symbols. It also offers a new Space Marines warlord and his eight-card signature squad, along with new cards for the other factions. When the Black Templars arrive on Sacaellum, you decide the success or failure of their quest!

189309.name: Psychonauts 2
189309.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Set a little after the events of the first game, which was set in a summer camp that provided training for mind-invading acrobats, it’ll follow Raz’s continuing adventures through the minds of other people as a professional Psychonaut.

189310.name: Enemies Beyond
189310.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the darkness of the far future, the Empire faces countless threats, but few rival that posed by the insidious powers of Chaos.

In Enemies Beyond, a new supplement for Dark Heresy Second Edition, you become an Acolyte with the Ordo Malleus—those tasked with battling the foul Daemons of the Warp. New Acolyte options allow you to play an Exorcised character or a powerful Astropath. Gazetteers offer information on Daemonic threats to the Askellon sector, and the GM will find rules for creating Daemon Princes, details on the rites of possession and exorcism, and guidance for crafting adventures for the Ordo Malleus!

189312.name: Enemies Without Character Creation Supplement
189312.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome, Acolytes, to the Dark Heresy Enemies Without Character Creation Supplement! Here players can find a plethora of new options to make their Acolytes created from the Enemies Without supplement even more unique, plus provide inspiration for building backgrounds and memorable histories. These are in no manner a required part of crafting a new Acolyte, but merely offer suggestions to aid in the character creation process as described in Chapter II of the Dark Heresy Core Rulebook.

The Game Master can also use the tables on the following pages to aid in crafting the Acolytes' Inquisitor or other especially important Non-Player Characters the Acolytes will meet in their adventures across the Askellon Sector.

These tables on the following pages can provide additional inspiration to players to flesh out minor personal details for their Acolytes, such as appearance and minor physical peculiarities, special homeworld beliefs, and mementos from their lives before joining a warband in service to an Inquisitor. Players are encouraged to explore using these as launching points to create additional narrative for their characters' upbringing and prior service, such as lost loved ones, cherished childhood memories, pivotal encounters, and other events that helped shape them into the persons they are now.

189313.name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Press the Attack
189313.description:
Description from the publisher:

Forge an alliance with the Ewok tribes, lead your elite strike team to assault the shield generator, or use the Death Star's superlaser to destroy the Rebel fleet. As part of the Endor cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game, Press the Attack invites you to experience the climactic events of Return of the Jedi as you reenact the movie or create your own stories. Within this Force Pack, you'll find a renewed focus on Endor objectives, gain the support of the Ewoks with C-3PO, and battle your foes as the dark side Force user, Maw. As the Battle of Endor intensifies, command your forces with Press the Attack.

189314.description:
Description from the publisher:

Explore the more transcendent qualities of life on the Network. The idea of an expanded consciousness runs throughout The Liberated Mind, the fifth Data Pack in the Mumbad Cycle for Android: Netrunner, and you'll find the mysterious Temple of the Liberated Mind given shape, alongside several of its members and their philosophies. Sixty new cards (including a complete playset of nineteen different cards) allow Runners to explore life, death, and rebirth in the virtual realm. Meanwhile, Corps gain new means to counter the Runners' efforts and to use the Runners to further their own agendas.
189314.name: Android: Netrunner – The Liberated Mind
boardgamepodcastepisode: Breaking News — Episode 48

189316.name: Wayfinder (Issue 14 - Dec 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Fighting Alongside Fang, Claw, Tusk, And Wing
Grandmother’s Pact: A Song Of The Winter Wolves
Pc Race: Maftets Of The Desert Sands
Remnants And Relics Of The Ghol-Gan
Sacred Sacrificial Sites Of Inner Sea Monsters
The Oiv’heur’eihr: Orphans Of The Black
Weal And Woe: Blood And Sport
Weal Or Woe: Spider And The Fly
189316.description:
From the Paizo website:

Created for Pathfinder fans by Pathfinder fans, this monstrous fourteenth issue of the ENnie Award-winning Wayfinder fanzine takes a walk on the wild side, with its focus on monsters! This free fanzine includes dozens of articles, including original fiction, new monsters, adventures, classes and options, magic items, and even PFACG scenarios—this is just a small portion of what awaits you!

Wayfinder #14 is a 80-page full-color PDF suitable for printing or viewing on your computer. It is released under the Paizo Inc Community Use Policy.

189317.name: Wer pupst?
189317.description: A children's game with an electronic device that allows one of the three to four players to let a farting sound occur. It's then the others players job to decide which player "farted" and the farting player's job to deceive the others about his fart.

189318.name: Nandeyanen!? - The 1st Sûtra
189318.description:
Join Tengu-man in an all-out Yôkai war where no bullets are pulled back. Master complex game mechanics in this first chapter of a supernatural adventure. Counter bullets and blast shields to find your foxy lady.

Source: The Developer Website.

User summary - 2D side-scrolling Japanese mythology shooter where you play a long-nosed goblin who has woken up after a thousand year nap and isn't very happy...

189319.name: Bubbles
189319.description:
24 cards, each of them showing four bubbles in four different colours (red, green, blue, yellow), are laid out on the table. Four dice, in the same colours, are rolled.
