Their faces show values from 1 to 24. All players then simultaneously try to find the card on which the bubbles' sizes match the die roll. E. g. if the green die shows the highest value, the blue one the second highest, the red one the third highest and the yellow one the lowest, players have to find the card on which the green bubble is the biggest, the yellow one is the smallest etc. The player who is first to find the correct card puts it in front of him/herself. If the same combination is rolled again, another player can steal the card.
The first player to collect four cards wins the game.

189320.name: Maison Kanraku: The Second Climax
189320.description:
Maison Kanraku is a NEC PC-Engine style panty-throwing simulator. Experience the high resolution of thrown-away pixelated panties as they distract an army of conservative landladies and janitors.

Source: The Developer Website.

This game was made during the (Swiss Castle) Global Game Jam 2015.

The Windows version can be downloaded for free from the developer's website. http://tchagata.com/games/maison-kanraku/

189321.name: Kingsport Festival: Dagon Scenario
189321.description: A special scenario card for a 2 player game of Kingsport Festival (base game is for 3-5 players). This promo card was given away at Gen Con 2015.

189322.name: By the Gods (1986 Edition)
189322.description:
User summary:

By the Gods is an aid designed to serve several functions. In essence it is a game aid and (optionally) a system for playing deities of a variety of power and influence levels in settings appropriate to myth and legend. The orientation of the system is toward minor deities, demigods, and even epic heroes. The product is intended as a component of To Challenge Tomorrow and uses the basic rules from that system. The product also was intended to be used alongside a pantheon book form the same publisher.

189323.name: Nobis Adventure Hooks
189323.description:
From Introduction:

Everybody loves a head start. We’ve put together a number of adventure hooks that you can use with Nobis or with your own campaign world. There are also a number of campaign hooks in the campaign setting book Nobis: The City-States.

189324.name: By the Gods (1993 Edition)
189324.description:
User summary:

By the Gods is a game aid and system for playing deities of a variety of power and influence levels in settings appropriate to myth and legend. The orientation of the system is toward minor deities, demigods, and even epic heroes. The product is intended as a component of To Challenge Tomorrow and uses the basic rules from that system.

The 1993 Edition of the product includes the revised material from the earlier version as well as the revised pantheon materials. Revisions make the product compatible with To Challenge Tomorrow (4th Edition).

189325.name: The City-States Compatibility Guide to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game
189325.description:
From Introduction:

Make the following changes to your copy of Nobis: The City-States campaign setting guide to make it fully compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. The same changes should also be made to Nobis: The City- States Player’s Guide, but obviously, the page numbers will be different.

189326.name: Tempora Mutantur: Rules Supplement: Genotype Summary
189326.description:
From the introduction:

The post-Fall world is inhabited a wide range of humanoid species. A character's race - or genotype - determines his appearance, mutations, medical compatibility, and other traits.

189327.name: Danny Phantom: The Ultimate Enemy
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
189327.description:
It is based on the episode "The Ultimate Enemy" from the television series "Danny Phantom" and is the first video game for the series. Players play the role of Danny Phantom in his adventure to save Amity Park from a grim future and the hardest enemy Danny has ever faced: himself.

Source: Wikipedia, "Danny Phantom: The Ultimate Enemy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

rpgitemversion: PDF Full Rules Draft With Artifacts
189328.name: Synthicide Full Rules Draft
189328.description:
From the introduction:

The game is set in a Galaxy on the verge of collapse, where bullets are more common than food and equally essential for survival.

An evil mutant force called the Prodigravus attempted to absorb all of humanity. A millennium-long war ensued, destroying almost every civilized planet. Humanity descended into a dark age.

A tech cult called the Tharnaxist Church retained scraps of scientific knowledge. They used it to gain power over the surviving humans and mutants, but these cybernetic priests aren’t interested in the lives of organics. They only care about discovering more technology and building synthetic beings to run their society. Under Tharnaxist rule, the murdering of a robot – also known as Synthicide – is regarded as the highest crime on any planet. If one commits Synthicide and is caught, they earn the ire of the Church.

With human life devalued, remaining social structures have descended into barbarism, extortion, and gang-rule. Anyone with the means has become a Sharper: an independent agent that drifts from world to world, scraping by on dirty work. For a Sharper, floating through space is preferable to settling down on any Tharnaxist-ruled hellhole.

User summary:

The Synthicide Full Draft Rules were published September 28, 2015, to kick off the major public playtest phase of development.
The first major revision was published February 2, 2016, adding artifacts and some rules.

189329.name: Garden Rescue
189329.description:
Help the plants to defend the garden from being invaded by sneaky beetles. A swarm of beetles is heading to your garden, help the garden-inhabiting plants withstand the severe attack.

In this game you will have to fight against hordes of insects that are trying to demolish your garden. In this battle you will stand shoulder to shoulder with the plants living in the garden. Earn coins, upgrade your garden, place more plants, it's all in your hands alone!

A serious menace has approached the gentle and snug garden, where various plants have been quietly living - masses of voracious insects rushed to it to fill their maws. The green defenders had to lay aside their everyday jobs to save their tiny motherland. But who will command the defense, who will lead them in action? Head this little army of garden defenders, rescue them from impending doom!

Source: The Developer Website.

189330.name: Deep Deep Dungeon
189330.description:
Art by Luka Rejec - an amazing artist and gamer in Switzerland.
Inspiration comes from Drew Chamberlain (Dungeon Delve) and Nick Hayes (Utopia Engine).

189331.name: Europa Universalis IV: The Cossacks
189331.description:
The Cossacks is the sixth major expansion for Europa Universalis IV and focuses on Hordes and Eastern Europe.

This addition allows you to plunder your neighbours as a horde in order to keep your tribes loyal and raze their lands to gain power to advance in technology or reform into a settled nation. The internal politics of nations is brought to life with the Estates, representing powerful interests such as the Magnates of Poland-Lithuania and the eponymous Cossacks of the steppe. More detailed control over the cultures and natives living in your nation and the ability to work more closely with your AI allies and understand their goals will let you bring out your inner Peter the Great.

Main Features:
• Estates: Adds internal politics in your country, with power groupings such as the Church, Nobility and Bourgeois fighting for control.
• Diplomatic Feedback: Adds the ability to interact much more deeply with the AI by setting your attitude and telling it what you want out of wars.
• Tengri: New religion mechanics focusing on Syncretism. Tengri have a secondary religion that they fully tolerate, and can change this secondary religion at will.
• Horde Unity and Razing: Hordes must attack their neighbors to secure plunder in order to keep the tribes happy, or risk a tribal uprising. Hordes can raze territories they conquer to get monarch points and raise horde unity.
• Advanced Culture Change: Adds the ability to choose what culture you want to convert a province to from any neighbouring culture, or restore the original culture of the province.
• Native Policies: Adds the ability to set your policy towards the natives in your colonies, allowing you to focus on trade, assimilation, or subjugation.
• Improved Espionage: Two new spy actions allowing you to study the technology of more advanced countries and agitate for liberty in your enemies subjects.

Source: The Publisher Website.

189332.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 190 - Dec 2015)
rpgissuearticle: 2015 Best of the Game Trade Award Winners
Ticket to Ride Map Collection - United Kingdom
189332.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 190
December 2015

Congratulations to the 2015 recipients of The Best of the Game Trade Awards!

Unleash the beasts with Wizkid's Dungeons & Dragons Icons of the Realms Miniatures Line!

189333.name: Ravensgate
189333.description:
User summary:

Ravensgate is the fourth adventure in a series set in the world of Jahannam. It was released in support of the 4th Edition of Ysgarth.

It went through at least four printings.

189334.name: Dungeon Kart
189334.description:
The spiritual successor to Tower Guard Games' first game Krash Karts, Dungeon Kart improves upon the original in every way, introducing a refined rulebook, higher quality components, and new easy-to-learn streamlined mechanics. Karts can crash into other players, forcing them into certain directions, players, or items! Like Krash Karts, you still design the track as you race but now with Bottomless Pit, Ice, Lava, and Mega Jump track tiles and new short-cut opportunities, all in a new fantasy dungeon theme! Gather fantasy themed items to blast opponents and gather the most loot the fastest to win!

More info coming soon.

189335.name: Golf On Board
189335.description:
The game consists of a board showing an 18 hole golf course which lists the par for each hole, 5 special 6 sided dice, one four sided die, four player tokens and four packs of 100 cards, one pack for each player.
Holes are either par 3, 4 or 5 and there is a unique die for each par which the player rolls first on a hole. Depending on their roll result they will then have to roll a second time/die and depending on this result, may have to roll yet another die.
Depending on the roll results players will select cards from their deck which record their scores.
After an agreed number of holes players add up their selected cards to determine their final score and the lowest wins.

189337.name: 73 North
189337.description:
Covering the Battle of Barents sea by solo.

A player controls the JW515B convoy to transport the supply to Murmansk. The German subs and air raids are controlled by the system using the playing cards.

189338.name: Flip 22
189338.description:
A dice rolling and flipping game with Flip Dice in which players try to make 22 (the total of the high sides of the set of four Flip Dice). In attempting to do so, players must choose to press their luck and play (at the risk of having to double the pot of chips if they roll all the low sides of the Flip Dice) or play it safe, pass their turn, and hope someone else loses.

Once one player loses all their chips at the end of a turn, the other players with chips remaining record their number of chips left (as points). Then a new round is started and play continues until someone reaches 50 points.

189340.name: Martial Arts: The Card Game – Series 2
189340.description:
Introducing Series 2 of Martial Arts: The Card Game, a 2-4 player deckbuilding game that focuses on real martial arts rather than flying off walls and throwing fireballs. Using our Velocity Engine, you can pick up a deck and play as a different martial art style using strategy, speed, and quick thinking without having to micromanage your decks. Because this is also a deck building game, you can mix and match any of the cards from Series 2 or 1 and create your own fighting style, much like a honed practitioner would.

Play as "Anything Goes" where weapons and illegal moves are ok or try our different modes, like playing solo or Army of One where you can have up to 10 players!

Series 2 includes these pre-constructed deck styles:


Sumo
Drunken Fist
Tae Kwon Do
Shaolin Kung Fu
Brazilian Jujitsu
Capoeira

189341.description:
Timeline: Québec is a card game played using 110 cards. Each card depicts a historical event on both sides, with the year in which that event occurred on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

Timeline: Québec can be combined with any other title in the Timeline series.

Card represent event related to the culture of the province of Québec in Canada.
189341.name: Timeline: Québec
boardgamepodcastepisode: Podcast EP09 – Jeux « Filler » et Café l’Aléa

189342.name: NHL Brainpucks
189342.description:
From the back of the box:

Brainpucks is a game of strategy that combines the simplicity of tic-tac-toe, the game of chess and the thrill of hockey.

Be the first player to align 4 pucks in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal fashion. Personalize your game board with your favourite team logos!

189345.description: Set of 5 number dice for The Great War board game
189345.name: The Great War: Set of 5 Number Dice

189347.description:
Extra set of 15mm (1/100th scale) hard plastic German game miniatures:-

48 Infantry

3 bomber figures

3 Maxim machine guns and 12 crew

3 Trench mortars and 12 crew
189347.name: The Great War: Extra Set of German Miniatures

189348.description:
Extra set of 15mm (1/100th scale) hard plastic British game miniatures:-

48 Infantry

3 bomber figures

3 Vickers machine guns and 12 crew

3 Trench mortars and 12 crew
189348.name: The Great War: Extra Set of British Miniatures

189349.description: Expansion for the game Caçadores da Galáxia. Includes new pilots, new robots, components to add a 5th player and add 2 new modules to the game: expeditions and Mafia+Space police
189349.name: Caçadores da Galáxia: Fronteiras

189350.description:
There's no question: the life of an artist is hard. There’s no paycheck to paycheck to live by. What little money you do have you invest right back into paint. And without that paint, there’s no way to follow your dream. You don’t relish the idea of having to work at a desk, in front a computer, toiling away for some faceless corporate overlord. You really want to make it!

Starving Artists is a game for 2-4 players. It takes about 30-60 minutes (approximately 15 minutes per player).

In Starving Artists, you are a painter trying to be famous. In the game, paints are the only currency. On your turn, you can buy canvases, paint them or work for more paint. And, at the end of each round, players can put their completed paintings up for sale for more paint and food.

The game ends when shortly after someone is out or someone manages to paint enough paintings: either in value or quantity. Yes, you can become famous by flooding the painting marketplace.
189350.name: Starving Artists
boardgamepodcastepisode: 9. Devon Dice Podcast - The Gallerist Review  and more
Episode 22 - Games Rule, Rulebooks Drool
Episode 24 - Trajan 2-Player Review
Episode 39 - Our Most Anticipated Games in 2017
Episode 40 - Asymmetric Games for Two
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 72!!

189351.description:
A frightening virus, Virus Q, is spreading in the major cities of the planet. Infected people and animals change rapidly, becoming horrible bloodthirsty and almost unstoppable creatures. Our only hope is to find the zero patient and the place where everything originated. There, perhaps, we can find an antidote and return the hope to the dying humanity.

But not everyone agrees. There are those who want to take advantage of the chaos and terror in order to gain power and establish a new form of government, trying to maneuver and control the monsters generated by the virus. A cure would ruin their plans forever.

The virus was created in a secret military lab, in a space that's practically inaccessible. Inside, Virus Q spread for the first time, accidentally, maybe; the creatures that now inhabit the Lab are difficult even to imagine...

In the innovative lab crawler game Virus, players are the team that infiltrates the Lab looking for the antidote to Virus Q. They will collect the few and fragmentary bits of information scattered in the laboratory, avoiding or fighting the monsters that populate it.

The map generation and the movement/placement of monsters depends on the player actions with a semi-automatic mechanism controlling what takes place where. The fighting requires some dexterity elements as well as players must plan their tactics by combining their shooting power with available movement, achieving successes by rolling cubes.

Also, the game takes place in real time!

In sum, you can play Virus cooperatively, semi-cooperatively or competitively. The "infiltrator" option makes the game even more exciting and unpredictable!
189351.name: Virus
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 102- Conflict of Heroes
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 030b – Essen 2016

189352.name: Man's Best Friend
rpgseries: Case Files of the Blue Book Detective Agency
189352.description:
From publisher blurb:

…Everybody is waiting… The first noise – start of artificial “rabbit”, one second later: all 8 doors are opened and dogs are running like a wind to chase a lure… First one number 8, second one – number 1, than 3, 7… But everything could change before they cross middle of track… Go! Go! My lucky 2…”

This is the part of a series of modules after several decades for use with the GANGBUSTERS™ RPG rules. Joe’s Diner is specially designed for the game judge who needs to get back up to speed with the system.

New Skill and Dog creation rules inside.

Gangbusters is a game that takes place in the Roaring 20’s and early 1930’s, essentially the Prohibition Era, of America. The focus of the game is on the Prohibition and the police/law enforcement struggle to control the streets and the halls of power. The player characters can take the roles of law enforcement, criminals, and other types of roles. The game is based in Lakefront City, ostensibly a fictional Chicago.

189353.name: The Telekinetic's Handbook
189353.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Telekinetic’s Handbook is an expansion to the Telekinesis sphere from the Spheres of Power magic system. Inside these pages you’ll find new talents, new feats, new magic items, expansions and explanations of telekinetic mechanics, new rituals and incantations, and more to help make the most out of this great branch of magic.

189354.name: Rituals of the Dead
189354.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mysteries From Beyond the Grave

Occult rituals, from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Occult Adventures, bring magic to the masses, with lengthy and difficult to perform magical rites which can be performed even by non-spellcasters, but which come with a cost, as well as the risk for terrible backlash to occur for those who meddle in things they do not understand. Unlike traditional spells, only a handful of occult rituals made it into that book however, which begs the question of what other strange and unknowable rituals might be lurking about in obscure tomes lost to history and memory. Tomes like this one.

This book presents a collection of 10 brand new occult rituals for use in your game, all of which are thematically linked to death, the afterlife, and the undead. Presented in the guise of a fictitious tome that player characters might stumble across, the book also includes a flavorful introductory section that can be read aloud or handed out to players, and suggestions for how to incorporate the book into your game. The rituals in this book allow players (or nefarious NPCs) to:

Anchor the spirits of the dead to the Material Plane, using them to create haunts of whatever type the caster desires.
Conjure the spirit of a shadow demon into the body of a deceased, seeming to restore them to life, but actually just allowing the demon to use their body as a puppet.
Steal the appearance of a corpse, allowing you to look and sound like the creature did when it was alive.
Transform yourself into one of several different kinds of vampires.
And much, much more!

189355.description:
Although Arcade is a top-shelf, laser-cut acrylic product, it comes with a space-sized card to act as the "dicecompass", which shows which directions missed shots go. This Dicecompass is made just like a floor space, out of laser-cut black acrylic, but with the die faces laser-etched into the surface.

nestorgames offered this goodie for free as an incentive for Arcade orders placed before 2015-12-31. It may be available for purchase separately thereafter.
189355.name: Arcade: Reinforcements – Acrylic Tiles: Dicecompass

189356.description:
Savage's Station is the third game in the Blood Before Richmond series, following Gaines's Mill and Glendale & White Oak Swamp; it actually takes place between those two.

The story of the Seven Days is the story of bizarrely incompetent leaders and badly-timed attacks, but Savage's Station really takes the cake. The usually wily Rebel general "Prince John" Magruder is charged with leading an attack on the lightly-defended Union rear, to be supported by three divisions under Stonewall Jackson. Jackson got confused and never showed (surprise-surprise), and Magruder, stoned out of his gourd on morphine, dragged his feet all day before finally launching a half-hearted assault after 5PM, which was ended by a sudden thunderstorm.

This is the smallest (and weirdest) of the games in the Blood Before Richmond series (only a half-sheet of counters this time around), and it's all about taking chances. The Confederate Player can bring in extra units, such as the famous Land Merrimack (a rail-mounted naval gun), but at the cost of precious VP. Will he have enough time to make up the difference, or will the game be called on account of rain?
189356.name: Blood Before Richmond: Savage's Station
boardgamefamily: Blood Before Richmond: Battles of the Seven Days

189357.name: Saikoro no Are
189357.description:
User summary:
The publisher refers to サイコロのアレ (Saikoro no Are) as 'That Dice Game' (an ironic joke).

Saikoro no Are is a mind game that uses dice, but players are not allowed to roll any die.

Active player's goal is to earn points by making a specific hand, such as three of a kind or four dice in sequence, with six dice. Non-active players' goal is to prevent the active player from making a hand by correctly specifying what number the active player chooses.

For each die, do the following actions:
1)The active player chooses a number and places a die to show that number. This action can be performed secretly or publicly.

2)All non-active player guesses what number the active player chooses, and place a die to show that number secretly.

3)Then, the active player may spend two victory points to change the number chosen.

4)Finally, all players reveal their dice. If the active player's chosen number equals any non-active player's, the attempt fails and that non-active player gains victory points.

Once the active player has failed a number of times equal to the number of non-active players, that player's turn is terminated with no victory points.

Otherwise, when the sixth attempt is finished, the active player gains victory points according to the hand made with the six dice. After each player has taken their turn being the active player, the highest scorer wins the game.

Any conversations, including bluffing, are encouraged during the game. The rules of the game are simple, but free conversation makes the game intriguing and exciting. You'll never know the strange feeling until you play.

Publisher's summary:
サイコロを振る事を禁止した今までに無い新感覚な心理戦ゲームです。
手番プレイヤーはサイコロの目を対戦相手にばれない様に役を作ります。
対戦相手は手番プレイヤーのサイコロの目を当てる事で点数を稼ぎます。
ゲーム手順
手番プレイヤーが先にプロットし、その様子を対戦相手が覗いてもOK！
その後、会話を自由に行い対戦相手がプロットを行う。
一度プロットした後は、一斉に公開するまで決して変更してはいけないが、
手番プレイヤーのみ２点支払うことで自由に変更しても良い！
単純ルールなのに奥の深い戦略。対戦相手の裏をかいて高得点を狙え！
遊ばないと伝わらない、不思議なゲーム感覚です。

189358.description:
From the publisher:

In 1907, the Imperial Chinese Navy proposed a new building program to provide three regional fleets, each built around a new modern battleship. Two years later a naval commission headed by the Regent's brother, Prince Tsai-hsun, recommended a fleet of eight dreadnoughts and 20 cruisers plus supporting vessels, and began soliciting bids from shipyards around the world.

China never built that fleet, but that doesn’t stop you from leading it into battle against the Japanese imperialists. Great War at Sea: Rise of the Dragon presents the Chinese line of battle as proposed by Prince Tsai-hsun, made up of ships built in Germany, Britain, Japan, Austria-Hungary, Italy and the United States.

The Chinese have nine dreadnought battleships: the eight new ships proposed by the Prince, plus the former Brazilian Rio de Janeiro. Plus the twenty proposed cruisers, and the destroyers, mine craft, gunboats and torpedo boats that made up the rest of the program.

Eleven new scenarios send this fleet into action against the Japanese in 1915, resisting Japan’s odious demands for control of Chinese ports, railways and mines. The Japanese have countered the Chinese buildup with additional new ships of their own, foregoing the reconstruction of captured Russian prizes to invest instead in additional new battleships and cruisers, including the small battle cruisers proposed in 1905.

Rise of the Dragon is a supplement for the Great War at Sea series, based on battles that never happened. It is not a complete game: Ownership of Russo-Japanese War, Pacific Crossroads and Central Powers (and only those three items) is necessary to play all of the eleven scenarios included.

Rise of the Dragon includes 90 laser-cut and mounted playing pieces: 50 "long" pieces representing major warships and 40 square ones representing smaller craft and fleet markers.
189358.name: Great War at Sea: Rise of the Dragon

189359.name: Second World War at Sea: South American Navies
189359.description:
From the publisher:

Our Second Great War setting is based on the premise that the First World War came to a negotiated end in late 1916, leaving the great empires intact but planting the seeds of renewed conflict a generation later. Second World War at Sea: South American Navies looks at the involvement of Latin America's leading powers: Argentina, Brazil and Chile.

Each of these fleets has undergone the expansion and reconstruction allowed by strong economic growth and relative political stability - without a German economic collapse to fuel it, the Great Depression is no more than a world-wide recession. Political and especially economic ties have aligned the Latin powers with their European partners: Argentina with Italy, Chile with Britain, and Brazil with the Central Powers of Imperial Germany and Austria-Hungary, while maintaining a strong trade relationship with the United States.

Their fleets reflect this: the Argentine battleships have been re-built along the pattern of the Italian Conte di Cavour class, the Brazilians much like American battleships, and the Chilean ships like their British near-sisters. And each has added new ships and aircraft from those sources in pursuit of a balanced fleet. Of course, there are airships as well.

South American Navies is a supplement for the Second World War at Sea series, based on battles that never happened. There are 12 new scenarios in a story arc following the participation of the South American fleets in the Second Great War. It is not a complete game: Ownership of Cone of Fire (and only Cone of Fire) is necessary to play all of the scenarios included.

South American Navies includes 90 laser-cut and mounted playing pieces: 50 "long" pieces representing major warships and 40 square ones representing aircraft.

189360.name: Great War at Sea: U.S. Navy Plan Gray
189360.description:
From the published:

Picking up the story from C.S. Navy: Plan Blue, Great War at Sea: U.S. Navy Plan Gray looks at naval operations in the Second War of the Rebellion as the outnumbered Confederate States Navy along with its British, Canadian and Imperial Mexican allies battles the much larger Union fleet.

In Plan Blue, we covered the early months of the war that followed the Confederacy’s surprising declaration of war against the United States. U.S. Navy Plan Gray sees action taking place in both the North Atlantic theater (on the map from U.S. Navy Plan Red) and in the Caribbean (on the map from U.S. Navy Plan Gold). The Confederates have managed to keep their communications to Britain open, but now the North threatens the economically-vulnerable southern flank of the Confederate Empire in places like Cuba, Santo Domingo and Panama.

The Union fleet adds powerful new warships: additional members of the New York, Nevada and Pennsylvania classes, fast battle cruisers, torpedo battleships (actually proposed in the real world!), some obsolete torpedo rams (the proposed improved version of the useless Katahdin), and the "small battleship" alternative armed with four 16-inch guns (also a real proposal).

The economically-weaker Confederacy tries to even things up with deadly but fragile torpedo cruisers and some small coast defense ships. The Imperial Mexican Navy is there to help out, with a dreadnought and some other foreign-built ships. And there are small contingents from the minor Caribbean powers, Denmark and the Netherlands.

U.S. Navy Plan Gray is a supplement for the Great War at Sea series, based on battles that never happened. It is not a complete game: Ownership of U.S. Navy Plan Red, U.S. Navy Plan Gold, Jutland, C.S. Navy: Plan Blue and Confederate States Navy is necessary to play all of the ten scenarios included.

Plan Gray includes 80 laser-cut and mounted playing pieces: 60 "long" pieces representing major warships and 20 square ones representing smaller craft.

189361.name: Kampen om Uppsala
189361.description:
This belongs to a series of promotional Monopoly clones featuring local businesses and trivia, published around 1988-1992. As in Monopoly you move around a board collecting "shares" and hope for others to land on your properties, although the specifics are slightly different. Obviously the trivia elements vary from game to game within the series, and there are also some small mechanical variations, e.g. in the composition of event cards and how rent is calculated.

This particular entry in the series has trivia questions on some cards meant specifically for children, although there's no guarantee they'll be any easier to answer without specific local knowledge.

189362.name: Panzer Grenadier: 1942 – The Defense of France
189362.description:
From the publisher:

When France fell to the Germans in June 1940, she possessed a strong force of tanks and armored vehicles – many of them technologically superior to those of the Germans. Yet even better tanks and guns had been designed. Some of these existed as prototypes, and some had even entered production but had not reached front-line troops in significant numbers.

Panzer Grenadier: 1942 - The Defense of France gives the French Army the chance to deploy these weapons against the German invaders. The high-velocity 47mm APX anti-tank gun did appear in time for the 1940 campaign, but only in very small numbers – not enough to influence the course of the campaign. That’s not the case here, and the French also receive the planned new versions of the Somua S35 medium tank (the S41), Char B1bis heavy tank (the B1ter) and the new AMX38 light tank, all armed with the tank version of the APX gun and with larger turrets and crews than the earlier models.

And there’s more, starting with the 75mm TAZ 39 anti-tank gun, the big brother of the 47mm APX, and the 90mm anti-aircraft gun, usable in an anti-tank role as well. The French also receive some additional first-line infantry, and the fully-tracked Lorraine 39 armored personnel carrier to bring them into battle. And finally, the Germans receive a battalion’s worth of the PzKpfw 747r – the Soviet-made T34 in German service.

But how to use all this heavy gear? 1942 - The Defense of France includes a set of 10 scenarios (that’s as many as some publishers will give you in what they call a “complete” boxed game), taking place as a small story arc in our Long War alternative history setting. Would the improved French armor and anti-tank guns have made a difference? You get to answer that.

1942 - The Defense of France is a supplement for Panzer Grenadier: 1940 - The Fall of France. It is not a complete game: ownership of 1940 and Kursk - Burning Tigers is necessary to play all of the 10 scenarios included. 1942 - The Defense of France also includes 88 laser-cut and mounted playing pieces.

189363.name: Black Company
189363.description:
User summary:
In Japan, a "black kigyou" (literally means "black company") is like a sweatshop company. When a company exploits its employees in illegal ways, it is called a black kigyou. Karoshi (death from overwork) is one of the most tragic results caused by such a company.

This game is a roll-and-move game with a theme of labor survival.

Players are new employees of a "black company". When employed, they are willing to work for that company with full motivation, but their motivation will diminish soon. Each turn, the current player rolls a die and advances their pawn that number of squares around the board. Then, depending on the square that player landed on, a trouble or a disaster may happen, reducing that player's motivation (and sometimes other player's too). A player wins the game if all the other players' motivations are reduced to zero.

Players' way to advance is actually a loop because there's no way out of the company. This game is a party game which is full of black humour.

Publisher's summary:
このゲームにおける""BLACK COMPANY""とは、過酷な労働環境で従業員を苦しめる「ブラック企業」を意味しています。「過労死」に代表される日本の黒い文化です。
このゲームは「労働サバイバルすごろく」です。
プレイヤーはブラック企業に入社してしまった従業員となり、ボードに描かれた家から会社、また会社から家へというサイクルを繰り返しながら、心と体の充実度「いきいきポイント」が少しずつ減少していきます。
最後まで「いきいきポイント」が0にならず生き残ったプレイヤーの勝利です。
ブラックユーモアを交えたパーティーゲームです。

189364.name: Wabbits
189364.description:
The object of Wabbits is to win four carrots by forming words fast. You form four-letter words by pairing up word bit cards or tiles from your hand and/or from the supply pool in the middle of the table. Word bits are fixed two-letter combinations that can form words when combined correctly.

Examples:

WO + RD = WORD

PL + AY = PLAY

It takes two word bits to form a word, and you must use all of your cards/tiles. At any time and as often as you want, you can discard any unwanted word bit by putting the card/tile face up in the pool and picking up a new or discarded one. Go fast; up to a dozen others are forming words at the same time as you!

It doesn’t matter if you are a BUNNY, RABBIT, HARE, or JACKRABBIT! When skill levels differ greatly, level the playing field by using the skill cards which are numbered from 1 (beginner) to 8 (expert). The number in one’s card is the number of words one has to form. Less experienced players can win because they need to form fewer words. Whoever finishes first gets the carrot!

And the more you win, the harder it gets to keep winning! After winning a carrot, your target number of words goes up by one for the next round.

Players leading during a game have to work harder for the next carrot, and so the others always have a good chance of catching up. The game is never over until the last carrot has been won.

189365.name: Imperial Regalia of Japan
189365.description:
User summary:
カムダカラ (Kamu-Dakara) are "the Imperial Regalia of Japan". Consisting of the sword Kusunagi, the mirror Yata no Kagami and the jewel Yasakani no Magatama, these are sacred treasures of Japan and are supposedly stored in three locations in Japan.

In this game, which takes place in ancient Japan, the turn player offers three cards, each with a different bonus specified on it, to another player who chooses to receive one of them. The turn player can keep the remaining two cards. By repeating this, the players compete to achieve the highest score.

Publisher's summary:
3つの異なるボーナスが描かれたカードを
2つのボーナスを隠した状態で任意の参加者に差し出し、
差し出された相手は３つのうちどのボーナスひとつを受け取るかを選び、
残りふたつをターンプレイヤーが受け取る、
ということを繰り返し、最大点数を目指す
古代日本を舞台といたゲーム。

189366.name: Ni No Kuni II: Revenant Kingdom
189366.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Ni No Kuni II is a sequel to Ni No Kuni.

189367.name: Monsutā Fesutibaru ~ dai shuryō-sai kyōsan: Arisumetika renkin shōkai ~
189367.description:
User summary:
モンスター・フェスティバル ～大狩猟祭 協賛:アリスメティク錬金商会～ (Monsutā Fesutibaru ~ dai shuryō-sai kyōsan: Arisumetika renkin shōkai ~) means "Monster Festival - Big Hunting Festival, Supported by Arithmetic Alchemy Co. -" in English.

Try to achieve the number on the Monster cards placed in a row on the table by combining the number on Monster cards in your hand with Tool cards (basic mathematical symbols). As soon as you finish calculating, take the Order card immediately.

Publisher's summary:
場に並べられたモンスター（数字）になるように手札のモンスター（数字）と道具（数式記号）を使って素早く計算します。計算が決まったら即座に順番カードを取得します。

189368.name: Paragon
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Free-to-Play Game of the Year Nominee
189368.description:
User Summary

Paragon's heroes will apparently have special combat abilities based on what players choose to fight for: glory, pride, fortune or infamy.

189369.name: Rez Infinite
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best VR Game of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Music/Sound Design of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best VR Game of the Year Winner
2017 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Honorable Mention
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best VR/AR Game of the Year Nominee
189369.description:
User Summary

Rez Infinite is the sequel to Rez.

189370.name: Nushi mo Waru Yonou
189370.description:
User summary:
ヌシも悪よのぅ (Nushi mo Waru Yonou) in English is "You Are A Bad Guy Too".

Nushi mo Waru Yonou, meaning "You're a wicked one too", is a famous phrase used by cruel bailiff characters in Japanese period dramas, when they compliment wicked merchants for bribing them.

In this blind-bidding game, the players are merchants competing to win the favor of the bailiff to get ahead by riding roughshod over one another and become the wealthiest merchant in Edo, former Tokyo.

Publisher's summary:
『ヌシも悪よのぅ』は、日本の伝統と様式美に則った、ブラインドビット型の競りゲームです。お代官様に取り入り、他の商人を蹴落として、江戸一番の豪商を目指しましょう！！

189371.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 71/72 - Nov/Dec 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Doing It My Way: Dreamwalkers: Where Psionics Meets the Unconscious
Doing It My Way: Extending the Task Resolution System to D20 Traveller
In A Store Near You: InterAct Music System
Raconteurs’ Rest: Funny Fish: Changes of Mind, Part 3
189371.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #071/072: Nov/Dec 2015

Cover: Ian Stead

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller's web site.

189372.name: Eagle Flight
videogamehonor: 2016 CVA Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Best Game Innovation of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Best Technology of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Best Virtual Reality Game of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Game of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Immersive Reality Game of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Immersive Reality Technical Achievement of the Year Winner
189372.description:
User Summary

Fly around an abandoned Paris as an eagle, using just your head movements to control your flight.

189374.description:
Operational level game of the counterinsurgency campaign in 1969 in Binh Dinh province, central coast of Vietnam.

The Government player, commanding South Vietnamese, South Korean and American units, must protect and improve the security of the civilian populations and major highways while seeking and destroying the insurgent forces. The Insurgent player, commanding elements of the National Liberation Front and North Vietnamese army, must undermine the government's power and replace his governing structures with his own.
189374.name: Binh Dinh '69

189375.name: Valiant Girls
189375.description:
Publisher Blurb

A nano-game of bravery and action, to play in small bits of time. Two, three or four players, a table and about half an hour. You’ll need a deck of cards for this one.

User summary

Valiant Girls is a rules-light, short RPG by Meguey Baker about Ethiopian girls facing a challenge.

189376.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 6.

Contains:

1 alternative score token, to record points on the score track
1 alternative character token, to identify the player
4 bonus tokens "ski", which allows a player to rapidly catch the player ahead of him in points.
189376.name: Loony Quest: Bonusplättchen Skier

189377.name: Island of Death: Return to Malta
189377.description:
From the publisher:

In our game Island of Death, we studied Axis plans to invade the British-held island of Malta in 1942 by a combined airborne and amphibious attack. In the expansion book Fortress Malta we went into even more depth on those plans, and also looked at a number of alternatives including a daring 1940 plan for an Italian invasion and a German airborne attack in 1941.

Had any of those plans succeeded, the Axis powers had prepared for the occupation as well. The Italian XVI Corps, consisting of the 26th “Assieta” and 54th “Napoli” infantry divisions, would remain on the island as its garrison, together with some units of the Royal Italian Navy (chiefly coast-defense artillery). That would provide an occupation force roughly the same size as the wartime British garrison, as Italian infantry divisions were smaller than their British counterparts.

The Allies appear to have had no well-developed plans to re-take the island in the event of its fall. Britain held Malta and had no intention of surrendering it, nor did the Maltese. But we can make an informed guess as to what formations would have been available for a counter-invasion of Malta, and that’s the basis of Island of Death: Return to Malta.

Return to Malta has 180 new playing pieces representing the Canadian 2nd Infantry Division, the Polish Parachute Brigade, the U.S. Marine Corps’ 2nd Provisional Brigade and two small brigades of Royal Marines. Their task is simple: take Malta back from the Italians.

Return to Malta is not a complete game: Ownership of Island of Death and Fortress Malta (and only those two items) is necessary to play all of the four scenarios included.

189378.name: Mountain Tour
189378.description:
The mountain is calling! The path is steep, the gorges treacherous. With concentration and skill to the peak of happiness.

This game is similar to Labyrinth except that it has been stood up on its end. The player must move a small metal ball around the path on the board using a system of simple pulleys. Should the ball fall through a hole, you have to start over.

189380.name: Hard 'n' Heavy
189380.description:
User Summary

Originally developed for Rainbow Arts as "Giana 2 – Arthur and Martha in Future World", the legal fallout from Great Giana Sisters caused a name change and a re-skin to move from a fantasy to a space setting. Instead of two children, the player now controls two robots known as "Heavy" and "Metal". This wasn't enough though and the game was eventually released only in Germany, and by ReLINE rather than Rainbow Arts. It only received a release in English-speaking countries on later compilations.

The Gameplay remains highly reminiscent of the Mario games, with a left to right scrolling playfield and blocks to break. Coins are replaced with diamonds (or "Lithium"). Differences include that the player starts with a bouncing shot similar to a fire-flower which can be upgraded through the game to fire multiple shots. The player also has a shield and a smart-bomb which clears all enemies on the screen.

Multiplayer gameplay is unusual. As well as the standard hot-seat mode where control switches at the end of each life, with each player carrying on where they left off, there are two other options. Dead Mode is a cooperative mode with two players controlling the same robot, but control switched when a life is lost or at the end of a level. Time Mode also has both players controlling the same robot, but control switches every 10 seconds - particularly challenging in a platformer!

189381.name: Milestones
videogameversion: English/German European Atari ST 3.5" Disk edition
English/German European Commodore Amiga 3.5" Disk edition
189381.description:
From the back of the box:

Jedes Spiel für sich, ein Meilenstein der Softwaregeschichte:
Each game is in itself a milestone in software history:

Grand Monster Slam:

Das Fantasy-Sportspiel mit ulkig-witzigen Fantasy-Grafiken.
The fantasy sports game with cute graphics.

Circus Attractions:

Das Zirkusspiel mit 6 verschiedenen Disziplinen.
The circus game with 6 different disciplines.

Hard 'n' Heavy:

Das Jump'n Run Spiel um einen kleinen Roboter.
A robotic jump'n run.

Spherical:

Das Denk- und Geschicklichkeitspiel mit Magie, Logik und Intelligenz.
A magical brain teaser requiring skill, intelligence and logic.

189383.name: The 11th Hour
189383.description:
From the introduction:

This is a short fantasy adventure interlude for 1st level characters. However, unlike most adventures, The Eleventh Hour requires no combat to complete. Another unique aspect is that the adventure can be run in "real time" where keyed events happen at specific times during the adventure's hour-long loop.

189384.name: Blast From the Past
189384.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Ronin Arts’ Superline #3: Blast From The Past, the third in a series of adventure and rules supplements licensed under the M&M Superlink banner. The gist behind the Superline series is to present fan-oriented gaming material for M&M Superlink in a comic book format and with comic book spirit.

189385.name: Vom Neckar zum Rhein
189385.description: Objective: be the first to travel to arrival point, learn more about folks and country. It is a simple 'Roll and Move' game, moving by turn.

189386.name: A Moment on the Subway
189386.description:
From the introduction to the game

A Moment on the Subway is an RPG Poem for three players, that takes place in the ten minutes after two people have noticed each other for the first time. It's love at first sight... now what?

There are five roles in this RPG Poem. Two of the players need to play the two lovers. The third player will play the friend, the drunk, and the business man.

189387.name: Seance: A role-playing poem
189387.description:
Seance, a role-playing poem for 4-8 people

User Summary
Seance is a freeform nano-RPG/ game poem in which a few people, with the help of a medium, ask questions of a deceased person.

189388.name: Overture
189388.description:
Overture is an action-adventure roguelike that allows you to explore vast and randomly generated dungeons, slay hordes of enemies, find companions to fight with, and upgrade your characters!

Source: The Developer Website.

189389.name: Orcology: a roleplaying poem with scientific depth
189389.description:
ORCOLOGY
- a roleplaying poem with scientific depth

User summary
You play scientists in the new field of orcology, discussing a spectacular new find.

189390.name: Road Running
189390.description:
From the game
A road-movie based role-playing game for 2+ players
By Juan Manuel Avila

You are leaving town, running away from the law by car. What crime did each one of you committed? Why did you do it? Which illegal thing are you taking with you?

User information
This game was created for David Schirduan's 200 Word RPG Challenge 2015.

189391.name: Republic Serial
189391.description:
From the game text

Artificial earthquakes are destroying the Earth. Scientists have
found they are caused by a beam from the planet Vesu.
You are travelling there in a rocketship to find the source and turn off the beam. But a ray from a mysterious Citadel has hit the
rocketship, and it is about to crash into the planet...

User summary
Republic serial is a fast-paced game of space pulp heroics. it was submitted to the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2015.

189392.name: Copy: A Roleplaying Game About Clones
rpg: Copy: A Roleplaying Game About Clones
189392.description:
User summary

Each player is a clone of the same person. Together, you roleplay a special day for this person. Do you work together, or do you get in the way of yourself?

This game was submitted to the 200 Word RPG Challenge 2015.

189393.name: Demented
189393.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

A first-person horror game set in a strangely colourful world where you're trying to find out what has happened to you before you go insane.

189394.name: Colt Express: Le tunnel avant l’arrivée en gare
189394.description:
Promotional card enclosed to "Plato Magazine #74".

It allows players to play 3 cards face down through to the tunnels, during the tunnel rounds whenever a bandit is hit with a gun he has to let a purse drop to the ground, exactly as happens when you get a punch.

Le tunnel avant l'arrivée en gare

Il s'agit d'une carte d'arrivée en gare à mélanger avec les autres avant d'en piocher une au hasard.
Elle se joue en quatre manches: Tunnel - Tunnel - Tunnel - Normal
Pendant tous les tours de tunnel, les tirs permettent de faire tomber un butin exactement comme si on donnait un coup de poing.

189395.name: Zodiac: Orcanon Odyssey
189395.description:
The game plays as a Japanese role-playing video game, specifically taking elements from Final Fantasy, Valkyrie Profile and Dragon's Crown.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zodiac: Orcanon Odyssey", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189396.name: Hob
189396.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

The darkness rumbles to life. Massive gears turn their teeth, shifting ancient monoliths into place. A door opens.

Dappled forest light beckons you from your chamber, entering an unknown world both beautiful and dangerous, buzzing with life above and whirring with mysterious machinery below.

Hob is a vibrant, suspenseful adventure game. As players delve into the mysteries around them, they discover a planet in peril. Can it be mended, or will the world fall further into chaos?

Source: The Game Website.

189397.name: The Tower of Elements
189397.description:
User Summary

This simple action game has you as a sorcerer atop a tower. As creatures climb up ropes on the right and left sides, you send down spells to eliminate them before they get to the top and kill you. You have three types of enemies (red, green, blue) on either side, so you have, in total, six commands you can send depending on the enemy and the side. The enemies speed up as the game progresses but you can upgrade the tower with gems to improve your chances at survival.

189398.name: Panzer Grenadier: Iron Curtain - Maple Leaf Brigade
189398.description:
From the publisher:

In 1951, Canada created a brigade to serve as its contribution to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization’s defense of West Germany against potential Soviet aggression. Initially designated as the 27th Infantry Brigade, the unit would go through a number of re-namings and re-structurings over the years that followed until the withdrawal of Canadian troops from Germany in 1993.

Composed of long-service volunteers rather than the conscripts who manned other NATO formations, the Canadian Brigade set a standard for excellence in the Alliance’s ground forces, and would eventually be assigned a “fire brigade” role in planning for a potential ground war against the Soviet Union.

Iron Curtain - Maple Leaf Brigade introduces the Canadian Army to Panzer Grenadier. It’s part of our Iron Curtain setting, looking at a Cold War turned hot in the early 1950’s. There are 88 new playing pieces showing the Canadian Brigade in its configuration of that era, with a complete armored regiment and a small helicopter squadron as well as its tough infantry. Plus you get a set of 10 scenarios to use them (that’s as many as some publishers will give you in what they call a “complete” boxed game).

Iron Curtain - Maple Leaf Brigade is a supplement for Panzer Grenadier: Elsenborn Ridge. It is not a complete game: ownership of Elsenborn Ridge, Iron Curtain - Hammer & Sickle and Road to Berlin is necessary to play all of the 10 scenarios included. Iron Curtain - Maple Leaf Brigade also includes 88 laser-cut and mounted playing pieces.

189399.name: Ampersand
189399.description:
User Summary

You race against computer opponents, taking advantage of items and boosts on the track to get ahead.

189400.name: Bound
189400.description:
User Summary

Bound is a story driven game.

189401.name: Dead Star
189401.description:
User Summary

The game takes place on procedurally generated maps.

189402.name: The Neymar Board Game!
189402.description: The Neymar Board Game! appears inside the back cover of the book Neymar by Illugi Jökulsson. It follows the life and career of Brazilian soccer star Neymar. It is a simple roll-and-move game where players roll a die to progress along a track. Spaces along the way refer to setbacks and successes in Neymar's life and career, corresponding to moving forward or back on the track or gaining or losing turns. The first player to reach the end of the track by an exact roll wins.

189403.name: Doctor Panic: Klaus Santa
189403.description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 7.

Klaus Santa has hurt his back by providing games to gamers! Save him quickly!

Klaus Santa is an exclusive and limited patient for Doctor Panic.

This single card was released Dec 7, 2015 as one of the expansions contained in the Advent Calendar to promote the future release of the base game.

189404.name: Miracle Fly
189404.description:
User Summary

Your character flies if she has enough charge and shoots stars behind her. You navigate a maze, collecting coins and gems, killing small and large bubbly creatures, before exiting.

189405.name: The Chronicles of Emerland Solitaire
189405.description:
To defeat the dark forces in the battle you will have to visit the Kingdom of the Elves in a vast forest; climb mountains and find the Dwarves' holy place wandering through cave mazes; sink to the ocean depths to protect the Kingdom of the Mermaids from imminent destruction and to save the shrine of the Kingdom of the Humans from ruin.

When deciding to learn card magic in a school of an old wizard you could not imagine that you would be chosen by fate as a saviour of an entire world. Emerland is an ancient world of magic, where the fragile balance is threatened by the evil sorcerer Sat. Consolidate around you the races populating this fairy land: Elves, Humans, Dwarves and Mermaids. Only together you can challenge him!

Source: The Developer Website.

189406.name: Trodox (Issue 38 - Aug 2015)
189406.description: This issue contains part 2 of the science-fiction novel "Die Grenzwelt" (32 pages) and the RPG crime scenario "Fifth Avenue" (5 pages) which is most suitable for Call of Cthulhu or KULT.

189407.name: Levy Men
189407.description:
Levy Men (or "Caballeros & Campesinos" in the spanish version) is a set of rules designed to abstractedly simulate combats that represent from skirmishes with dozens of miniatures to big battles with hundreds of miniatures per side.

For 2 players, it was conceived to be played in a fast and dinamic game mode that will allow the players learn and implement the simple rules rapidly.

The objective of the ruleset is to serve as a “starter game” for those not familiar with wargames and, for the experience players as a “filler game” or just a way to play as much fast and masive battles in one gaming day!

189408.name: Chronos Record
boardgamepublisher: ビブリオゲームズ (Biblio Games)
189408.description:
User summary:
クロノスレコード (Chronos Record) is a card game using layers to show epochs in history. The game is for three players only.

"Brighten the history of our kingdom!" A whim of a king caused a history manipulation war that involved the whole continent. Send your armies, such as knights, mages, and dragons into the past, and gain supremacy of the continent in every epoch.

Chronos Record is a three-dimensional area influence card game. This game uses four sheets of 9-pocket TCG protector. Bind these four sheets to form a four-layer playing-field. Each layer represents a certain epoch. The top layer is the present and the bottom layer is the oldest. Each pocket represents a territory. Because each layer is transparent, if you send your army to the oldest epoch, that army is visible (therefore active) until the present, unless another card covers the territory of more recent layer.

Each round, players play one card each in any vacant pocket, then score victory points from one randomly chosen epoch, according to the card locations visible from that layer.

After the seventh round, for each layer, if a player has the most cards visible from that layer, that player scores victory points.

There are 10 types of armies that have various abilities. You need to consider the abilities and synergies when planning your strategy.

Publisher's summary:
＜モチーフ＞『我が国の歴史を最も輝かしいものに！』ある国王の出来心から大陸全土を巻き込む歴史改竄戦争が勃発した。騎士、白魔術師、ドラゴンなど個性豊かなキャラクターを過去に送り込み、各時代の覇権を獲得しよう。

＜ゲームシステム＞TCG保存用カードバインダーを使った立体陣取り。『綴じられた4枚の9ポケットシートは透明なので、上にカードが置かれない限り、下のカードが見えたまま』という特徴を利用している。『毎ラウンド選ばれるページから見える配置が高い勝利点を生み出す事』、『ゲーム終了時に各ページから見える枚数でのエリアマジョリティーを獲得する事』を考えていく。10種類あるキャラクターカードの特徴を理解して戦略やコンボを考える必要もある。

189409.name: Nomad
189409.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Despite being blocky graphically, with a trite zombie-infested survival world, this game is not a rip-off of a Unity module, but a large world to explore, craft, and build a base. There is possible PvP but mostly it's a sandbox game.

189410.name: Irokata Origami
189410.description:
User summary:
いろかたおりがみ (Irokata Origami) is a puzzle game that uses origami (Japanese folding paper).

You are given a sheet of four-colored grid paper, and from a deck of cards you draw a pattern card. This depicts a certain shape with color pattern and a number of folds allowed. You pass the test if you have made that shape and color pattern by folding the given paper that number of times.

This game is recommended for 6 year-old and older people. A test is intended to be solved in around five minutes.

The game is sold with a sheet of folding paper and pattern cards in one package. You can print and play the game free by downloading PDF file of folding paper and 45 pattern cards from the publisher's dedicated website shown in the Weblinks.

Publisher's summary:
「いろかたおりがみ」はお題にある図の色と形に指定された回数で折るための折り方を探す、1人から遊べるおりがみをモチーフとしたパズルゲームです。
[6才以上向け,1お題あたり5分程度を想定]

専用おりがみとお題カードが一箱にまとまったパッケージがあります。
このページ下部のWeb Linkセクションにある、PnP edition on dedicated websiteのリンク先で、専用おりがみのPDFデータとお題のカードデータ(現在45種)を公開しており、自分で環境を揃えて無料で遊んでみることが出来ます。

189411.name: Thrones and Bones
189411.description: Thrones and Bones is a board game published in the book Frostborn by Lou Anders. It is based on the classic Viking board game Hnefatafl. Thrones and Bones is played on a 9x9 board, and shares the layout of the King's Table version of Hnefatafl. In general, movement and captures are handled as they are in Hnefatafl. However, this game adds a few new elements. The attackers, known as the Draug, have a special "leader" piece known as The Black Draug, who has special movement powers. Also, the starting squares of the attackers, known as the barrow mounds, are impassible to the Jarl and his defenders and also impassible to the Draug minions once they leave the barrow mounds. Only the Black Draug can move to any space on the board with no restrictions. However, the Black Draug is also vulnerable. If he is captured, all his minions are released and Jarl and his defenders win. The Jarl may also win by reaching any edge square other than those in the barrow mounds. As in Hnefatafl, the Draug win by capturing the Jarl by surrounding him on all four sides with Draug pieces or barrow mound squares.

189412.description:
In Taking Food From Bears, each player takes the role of a hiker trying to take food from a bear

At the beginning of the game, each player receives a set of seven cards, with numbers from 1 to 5, 1 whistle, and 1 bear trap. The Bear cards have values 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13, and 15. In a round, players attempt to steal from the target bear by playing his cards in sequence. The first player secretly looks at the target bear (the top bear card) and plays one of his number cards face up. If he plays a "3" card, it means that the player intends to steal 3 food from the target bear. Next players have two options: 1) look at the bear card just as the first player did and play a number card face up; or 2) play a number/whistle/bear card face down, take a multiplier (x2) card from the pool, and put the multiplier card on his face down number card.

After all the players played their cards, the Bear card is revealed. Beginning from the player who played the lowest card, add up the value of the number tokens. Suppose that the Bear is "9" and Josh played "3", Becky "5", Lupita "2", and Samuel "3" with "x2" multiplier on it, Lupita (2), Josh (3), and Samuel (3) are entitled to receive 2, 3, and 6 (3x2) food respectively. However, Becky will receive a wound (worth -2 food at the end of the game), since she fought the bear and lost. 9 is bigger than 2+3+3 but it is smaller than 2+3+3+5. Becky triggered the Bear's wrath. Playing the Whistle card will startle the Bear and trigger each other player to be wounded, but the player playing the Whistle card will receive no food this round. Playing the Trap card will keep the player safe against being wounded, but the player playing the card will receive no food this round. The player that received the most amount of food the last round, going clockwise from the starting player, starts the next round.

Play continues in this manner for a specified number of rounds,or until all the food is depleted, or until one player receives 5 wounds. The player with the most food at the game end is the winner.
189412.name: Taking Food from Bears

189413.name: Warrior Prestige Archetypes
189413.description:
From publisher blurb:


What is a Prestige Archetype?

A prestige archetype is a prestige class turned into a normal 20-level class, similar to an archetype or alternate class.

The goal when making these prestige archetypes has been to capture the flavor of the prestige class rather than to make an exact copy of how it would normally be. Attack bonuses, hit dice, class skills, spells, and class features have been unified and spread evenly over levels. This means that most prestige archetypes have their prestige abilities spread over the entire 20 level spread. Unlike how prestige classes normally work, these archetypes have a few complete class abilities rather than many abilities limited to a low level. In some cases, you get the choice of one of several class abilities rather than stymied versions of all the abilities.

A prestige archetype generally has elements of one or more regular character classes, to represent how prestige prerequisites were met and character development after the prestige class has ended. Sometimes there is more than one class that naturally leads itself to a particular prestige class, which can lead to several different prestige archetypes for different combinations. A few are not built on a regular class, instead expanding the idea behind the prestige class to a full 20 levels.


What is in the Product?

In this product, you will receive:

Eighteen warrior prestige archetypes designed by Carl Cramér based on the prestige classes found within numerous official sources.





Why Would I Want Prestige Archetypes?

Prestige Archetypes is something if you want if:

You want to design a character around a specific prestige class but do not want to worry about jumping back and forth between class books.
As a GM, you want a streamlined way to make a prestige class-based opponent to challenge your players as quick as possible.
Many prestige archetypes are tightly focused on their theme, meaning that you more of your time adventuring and less of your time leveling up your character.
As a GM, you want to provide new players with an easier class to get into that still possesses some exciting abilities.

189414.description: Zombies!!! 14: Space Bites! takes you out of this world, hopefully to live long and prosper — but this is no Hollywood script. Zombies plus a failing space station makes a happy ending highly unlikely...
189414.name: Zombies!!! 14: Space Bites!

189415.name: Imperial Harvest: Quest Deck Expansion
189415.description:
From the publisher:

8 UNIQUE QUESTS! Each one designed to challenge your tactics and entice you to explore new strategies as you seek to harvest those fabulous strawberries.

189416.name: Vortex Mk6
189416.description:
(translated) from the front page:

Vortex is a game system for space opera adventures, freely inspired by the D6 System, the Mini Six Bare Bone Edition, by Ray Nolan and Phil Morris and the D6 MKI by Kobayashi ; with bits of FFG's Edge of The Empire, and Métal, by the John Doe Team, for good measure.

More information

This game is in French only.

This is the core rule book.

189417.name: Feuille de Personnage
189417.description:
(translated) from the front page:

Vortex is a game system for space opera adventures, freely inspired by the D6 System, the Mini Six Bare Bone Edition, by Ray Nolan and Phil Morris and the D6 MKI by Kobayashi ; with bits of FFG's Edge of The Empire, and Métal, by the John Doe Team, for good measure.

More information

This game is in French only.

This is the character sheet.

189418.name: Aventures Fantastiques (version 1.7)
189418.description:
User Summary

Aventures Fantastiques is a French old school inspired Fantasy RPG that mix the rules of the basic system with the variety of the advanced one.

This is the revised version, numbered 1.7. Includes rules for characters up to level 7.

189419.name: Murder à la Carte
189419.description:
From the introduction:

Gafolweed's resident legendary adventurer and renowned author, Marcellus Drake is dead, and he named you as the heirs to his vast fortune. But the last will and testament reveals one shocking surprise - Marcellus prearranged his murder with someone else and that person is with you right now in the very same room. In order to inherit Marcellus' estate, you must unmask the killer. More importantly, you must [survive] the evening in his mysterious mansion replete with a cast of dangerous suspects, cryptic clues, secret passages, lethal traps and deadly guardians.

Does the party have what it takes to solve Marcellus' murder and claim their just reward?

189420.name: Borderlands Triple Pack
videogamecompilation: Borderlands 2 - Captain Scarlett and her Pirate's Booty
Borderlands 2 - Mr. Torgue's Campaign of Carnage
Borderlands 2 - Sir Hammerlock's Big Game Hunt
Borderlands 2 - Tiny Tina's Assault on Dragon Keep
Borderlands: The Secret Armory of General Knoxx
189420.description:
User Summary

Includes all three games and add-on content.

189421.name: Match Game
189421.description: In Match Game, players try to solve 12 questions relating to the placement of a set number of colored matches. The first player to place their matches correctly wins.

189422.name: Stack Attack
189422.description:
Description from the publisher:
You'll need a steady hand to attack this stack!

Roll and play your dice on the center Quake Plate!

You can build up the tower using neighboring numbers only (ie: if there is a 2 dot die as the last played, you can add a 1 dot, or a 3). So which direction should you go? That's part of the strategy! You'll want to play as many dice as you can... but not if it means the tower will topple!

Each player gets 5 dice and a dice rolling cup (everything is color coordinated, so you have a red player, orange play, green player, blue player).

Knock it over, you get no points, whereas each other player receives one point for each die they had in the fallen tower.

Get all your dice onto the tower before it topples? You get points and no one else does!

189423.name: Splitters!: Någon djävla ordning ska det va i ett parti
189423.description:
Splitters! is a card driven game about the left wing political movement of the 70s. The players take on the rolls of ideologists struggling to have the movement embrace their separate interpretations of socialism. The game either ends when a player successfully achieves three secret goals or when the last card is drawn from the deck, in which case the player who controls the most party members wins.

In the beginning of the game the whole movement is united in the "Party", but during the course of the game the players break out groups of members to form new parties. Each member tile has three opinions, each in different categories (colour, symbol and background). Playing an action card the player combines an action with on of these opinions to rearrange the members on the board - creating new parties, taking control of existing ones or transferring members from one party to another.

Inspired by Monthy Pythons "Life of Brian" Splitters! is a chaotic and humoristic game, which still leaves room for tactical depth.

Description in Swedish:
I Splitters! tar spelarna rollen som ideologer i 70-talets vänsterrörelse för att utkämpa en bitter kamp om vilken tolkning av socialismen som är den rätta. Konsekvensen kan bara bli en: Splittring! Kämpa för din övertygelse i försöken att genomdriva ditt politiska program och samla medlemmar i en miljö där partierna har en tendens att föröka sig like amöbor - genom delning.

Splitters är ett kortdrivet spel där spelarna försöker ta kontrollen över de medlemsbrickor som ligger på bordet. Spelet kan sluta på två sätt - antingen genom att en spelare lyckas uppfylla tre hemliga uppdrag (så kallade Övertygelser) eller när det sista kortet dragits ur högen och segern går till den spelare som kontrollerar flest medlemmar.
Vid spelets början är alla rörelsens medlemmar samlade i "Partiet" mitt på bordet, men under spelets gång bryter spelarna ut grupper av medlemmar som bildar nya partier, med allt längre och allt mer sekteristiska namn.
Varje medlemsbricka har tre åsikter i olika kategorier (färg, symbol och bakgrund). På sin tur kombinerar spelaren ett handlingskort från sin hand med en av dessa åsikter för att flytta runt medlemsbrickorna på bordet: skapa nya partier, ta över befintliga partier eller flytta medlemmar från ett parti till ett annat.

Inspirerat av Monthy Pythons "Life of Brian" är Splitters! ett kaotiskt och humoristiskt spel om 70-talets vänsterrörelse, som trots slumpfaktorer ändå har taktiskt djup.

189424.description: This is an extra set of 64 dice for Favor of the Pharaoh, ensuring that you will never have to share dice with anyone during the game.
189424.name: Favor of the Pharaoh: Extra Dice

189425.name: Alice's Nightmare in Wonderland
189425.description:
From the Back Cover:

Several years after the events of Alice's Adventures in Wonderland and Through the Looking Glass, Alice finds herself back in Wonderland and called upon to save the world of playing cards and talking animals from the increasingly deranged Queen of Hearts. But all is not as it first appears in the fluctuating dream world and soon Alice is battling to save herself from the nightmare that is rapidly overtaking the realm.

Have you ever wondered what would have happened if Alice hadn't drunk from the bottle labelled 'Drink Me', or if she hadn't joined the Hatter, the March Hare, and the Dormouse for tea? Well now you can find out. In Alice's Nightmare in Wonderland, YOU decide which route Alice should take, which perils to risk, and which of Wonderland's strange denizens to fight.

But be warned - whether Alice succeeds in her quest or meets a dire end as the nightmare escalates will be down to the choices YOU make.

Are you ready to go back down the rabbit-hole?

189426.description: Upgrade your Favor of the Pharaoh play experience with these engraved 1/8" Baltic Birch dice trays. Each set comes with 4 trays that replace the cardboard ones that come with the game.
189426.name: Favor of the Pharaoh: Dice Trays

189427.description:
From the publisher

Iron Bottom Sound III is a re-launch of Jack Greene’s award winning tactical naval combat game of the fighting in the Pacific in 1942-43. This game has been extensively updated from the original and includes twelve scenarios (and additional new rules) as well as additional ships for future scenarios to be made available on line at Quarterdeck International’s ConSim World (CSW) site.

Iron Bottom Sound III includes corrected scenarios from earlier versions, several 1943 actions, one Channel action between the Brits and the Germans, as well as two revised 1928 hypothetical actions between American and Japanese battleships and battlecruisers. The Japanese and Germans have slightly higher Victory Point value as their loss is tougher on them than the Allies.

This boxed bookcase style game (and a STOUT box at that!) weighing OVER a kilo contains the following components:

One 22.5” x 22” dark blue MOUNTED map.
Two cut out islands - one is Savo in the old traditional daylight hour’s style and Kolombangara in nighttime shades.
Two FULL countersheets. The ship counters, in Japanese and English, have top views on one side and silhouettes on the reverse for player’s choice. No generic images either, but the ACTUAL ship is displayed.
Two COLOR 11” x 17” combat charts, one in English, the other in Japanese.
Two 32 page rulebooks with scenarios with one ONLY in English. They represent my gaming philosophy of BIG print, plenty of room between lines (translation: EASY TO READ) – and the rulebook portion INCLUDING all optional rules are only 17 pages.
A 24 page “Ship Log” booklet with the scenario Roster Sheets for playing the scenarios in both English and Japanese, generic ship logs for making your own (as done in THE ROYAL NAVY) and a movement/attack log, all suitable for photocopying.
Game counters include all the ships and EXTRA ones too. Also torpedoes, smoke screens (NEW), fires, decoys (NEW), wrecks, fired markers (NEW) and starshells are included. Ships included are the YAMATO, MUTSU, NORTH CAROLINA, COLORADO, the battlecruiser LEXINGTON and more.
189427.name: Iron Bottom Sound III

189429.name: Donut County
videogamehonor: 2015 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
2015 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
2015 IndieCade Best Story/World Design of the Year Winner
189429.description:
In the game, the player moves a hole to swallow objects, which makes the hole increase in size. The concept originated in a game jam that used video game pitches from a parody Twitter account.

Source: Wikipedia, "Donut County", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189430.name: Fabulous Beasts
videogamehonor: 2015 IndieCade Best Technology of the Year Winner
189430.description:
User Summary

Fabulous Beasts is a game that was independently developed and played at game awards. The developers hope to secure further funding to polish the game.

189431.name: Line Wobbler
videogamehonor: 2015 A MAZE. Awards Audience Choice Winner
2015 A MAZE. Awards Most Creative Game of the Year Winner
2015 IndieCade Best Gameplay Design of the Year Winner
189431.description:
User Summary

Using the spring and knob from a shoe tree, you manage a lever that controls a green dot moving through an LED light strip. You'll sometimes come upon enemies represented as red dots, and you'll have to combat these by wobbling the spring lever, which results in your avatar turning yellow and bouncing around a few inches in a dash attack.

189432.name: Memory of a Broken Dimension
videogamehonor: 2015 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
2015 IndieCade Best Audio Design of the Year Winner
2015 IndieCade Best Visual Design of the Year Winner
189432.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




Memory of a Broken Dimension begins with a command prompt interface called RELICS through which the player must navigate to reach the game world. Once inside the first-person perspective 3D game, the player will find themselves in black and white, distorted and static-filled, areas. The player must move around shattered objects until their perspective shows them as a single object, at which point they can lock them in place as that object.

Source: Wikipedia, "Memory of a Broken Dimension", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

189433.name: Tribal & Error
videogamehonor: 2015 IndieCade Best Interaction of the Year Winner
189433.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




In Tribal & Error you’re a robot sent back to observe the ancient times, but the ice age is coming and to save humanity you need to learn their language first. You’ll Observe, repeat and master the cavemen tongue.

Source: The Game Website.

189434.description:
Lab Wars is the science themed card game of building up your lab and sabotaging your competitors all for scientific glory!

How to play:
